loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en:
Shahnaz is age 37, living with her two daughters and three sons in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a small vegetable shop for many years in a nearby town and earning a reasonable income. 

To grow his business, he is thinking of selling fruits in the evening so that he can increase his net income. With the passage of time, the inflation has been increasing day by day, but the sources of income remain constant. To increase his income, he wants to turn his enterprise towards progress, but for the purchase of fruits, he does not have a sufficient amount. He tried to borrow some money from his friends and relatives, but nobody helped him. Therefore, Shahnaz requested a loan for her husband so that her husband would be able to buy additional fruits to resell during the evening. Shahnaz says thank to Kiva and to its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy fruits for her husband to resell.

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en: Ma. Elena is 51 years old and married with five children. Ma. Elena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 29,500 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to resell. Ma. Elena has borrowed and repaid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 13 years and also earns an income from pig fattening. Ma. Elena aspires to save money to expand her business and to continue to send her child to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to resell.

loans.name: In

texts.en:
In is 54 years old and a widowed mother of four adult children of various ages. She is a housewife and farmer who has been farming rice and beans on her own land in the Kampong Thom province of Cambodia. She learned how to do this from her parents at an early age. Her short-term plans are to make her land fertile and productive and thereby increase her harvest because the entire family relies on this trade.

To maintain a good harvest, she is now asking for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR to buy pesticide spray to apply to her crops. Through the loan support, she hopes to earn a good profit after she has sold her product in the markets. She awaits your kindness, relies on your generosity and thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy pesticide spray to apply to her crops.

loans.name: Ma. Remy

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Ma. Remy works hard to support her family.

Ma. Remy operates a charcoal retail business in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from raising pigs.  Ma. Remy is requesting a loan of PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase more charcoal to sell to customers.

Ma. Remy has used her past three NWTF loans to sustain her business activities. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.es: Adelaida, a sus 36 años de edad es madre de 2 hijos y vive en unión libre con su compañero sentimental. Durante un tiempo su familia pasó por una situación económica complicada, pues ella se encontraba desempleada y el salario de su esposo no alcanzaba para cubrir todos los gastos del hogar, por lo que ella decidió iniciar su propio negocio con el ánimo de generar recursos para aportar a la economía del hogar. Fue por ello que montó un almacén de variedades hace aproximadamente un año aún sin tener conocimiento sobre el manejo del mismo, sólo impulsada por su espíritu emprendedor y utilizando el método de prueba/error. En el establecimiento ofrece productos de papelería, de aseo personal, cosméticos y adicionalmente presta el servicio de café internet con 3 computadores que posee, de esta manera ha logrado generar los recursos suficientes para continuar solventando los gastos familiares. El crédito que solicita es para invertirlo en la compra de surtido al por mayor (cuadernos, lápices, bolsas de regalo, cosméticos, productos de aseo, entre otros) y realizar mantenimiento y ampliar la memoria de los equipos de cómputo, así podrá prestar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, pues los equipos funcionarán más rápido y además tendrá variedad de productos disponibles para satisfacer las diferentes necesidades; esto se reflejará en el aumento de los ingresos que recibe diariamente, así irá organizando y acreditando su negocio, pues espera que en un futuro cercano pueda estabilizar su economía y brindar a sus hijos un mejor bienestar, educación y condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Adelaida is 36 years old and is the mother of two children.  She lives in a common-law marriage with her partner. At one time her family suffered through a financially difficult period when she was unemployed and her partner’s salary was not enough to cover household expenses.  So Adelaida decided to start her own business in order to generate income for her household and set up a general store about a year ago. Even though she had no experience, she was driven by her entrepreneurial spirit and used the trial and error method of running her store. In her store she offers paper goods, personal hygiene items, and cosmetics, and she also has three computers which she uses to provide an Internet café service. She has thus been able to generate sufficient revenue to continue to meet her household expenses.

The loan she is requesting is to invest in a variety of items at wholesale prices (notebooks, pencils, gift bags, cosmetics, and hygiene products, amongst others), and also to maintain her computers and expand the memory on them. This will allow her to provide better service to her customers because the computers will run faster and she will have more products available to meet their needs. This will result in an increase in her daily income allowing her to further organize and firmly establish her business.  She hopes that in the near future she can stabilize her finances and provide her children with better living conditions, a better education, and a better sense of well-being.

loans.use: to buy a variety of items at wholesale prices (notebooks, pencils, gift bags, cosmetics, and hygiene products, amongst others), and also to maintain her computers and expand the memory on them.

loans.name: Tubeheza Group

texts.fr:
Divine  fait partie du groupe  Tubeheza et  habite à Bujumbura. Elle  est mariée  à Willy, un  commerçant. Ensemble ils ont 7 enfants âgés de 1 à  14 ans, dont 5 étudient. 
 
Elle fait le commerce de  chaussures    depuis 15 ans. 

Elle est  cliente de Turame depuis 5 ans. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle  obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de  chaussures  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle  voudrait acheter une parcelle  et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Divine is a member of the Tubeheza group and lives in Bujumbura. She is married to Willy, a shopkeeper. Together they have 7 children between the ages of 1 and 14, 5 of whom attend school.

Divine has been in the shoe business for 15 years. She has been a Turame borrower for 5 years. With the Kiva loan she receives, she will increase her capital and purchase many shoes to resell in order to increase her earnings.

In the coming years, she would like to purchase a plot of land and to see her children continue their studies.

loans.use: to increase her capital and purchase many shoes to resell and increase earnings

loans.name: Shikana Group

texts.fr:
Rebecca  fait partie du groupe  Shikana  et  habite à Bujumbura. Elle est mariée  à Nathanael, un pasteur. Ensemble ils ont 9 enfants dont 2  étudient. 
 
Elle   fait le commerce des pagnes   depuis 23 ans. 

Elle est cliente de Turame depuis  8 ans. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle  obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup  de pagnes à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle  voudrait acheter une place pour le commerce, ouvrir une boutique  et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Rebecca is a member of the Shikana group and lives in Bujumbura. She is married to Nathanael, a shepherd. Together they have 9 children, 2 of whom attend school. She has been in the business of selling "pagnes" (traditional cloth) for 23 years. Rebecca has been a customer of Turame for the last 8 years.

With the Kiva loan Rebecca receives, she will increase her capital and purchase many "pagnes" to resell, in order to increase her earnings. In the coming years, she would like to purchase a location to conduct her business, open a shop, and see her children continue their studies.

loans.use: to increase her capital and purchase many pagnes (traditional cloth) to resell, in order to increase her earnings

loans.name: Shakeela

texts.en:
Shakeela lives in Lahore, Pakistan.

She used her old loans to purchase and maintain an auto rickshaw. Her husband has driven the rickshaw for many years. Due to constant use, the auto rickshaw is broken and needs proper maintenance. Therefore, Shakeela contacted Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, and requested a loan to fix the auto rickshaw.

She is grateful to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to maintain her auto rickshaw

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr:
Madame  Aminata est âgée de 47 ans,  mariée  et mère de 10 enfants. Elle vit dans une famille nucléaire au quartier Bagadadji de Ségou  (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Ayant abandonné l’école pour se marier par son propre volonté, elle commence à faire le commerce sur propre initiative. Elle mena beaucoup d’activités génératrices de revenus (vente d’habits, chaussures, couvertures, savons et condiments) en plus de toutes ces activités elle vend du bois de chauffage et du charbon de bois. Cette dernière activité elle la mène depuis 25 ans.  
Dans  le but d’augmenter son fonds de commerce afin de faire face à la demande clientèle, elle a fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est en relation avec cette dernière depuis 60 mois,  après 2 prêts solidaires et 4 prêts individuels    bien remboursés. Elle  est à son 5ème   prêt individuel qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter, 2 chargements de charrettes de bois de chauffe, 1 chargement de charbons de bois. Elle s’approvisionne sur place. 
Madame Aminata vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composé majoritairement de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 50 000 FCFA, qui lui sert à rembourser son prêt et à aider son mari  dans la prise en charge des dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
Aminata is 47 years old, married, and the mother of 10 children. She lives with her immediate family in the Bagadadji neighborhood of Ségou (the fourth administrative region of Mali.) 

Having left school voluntarily in order to get married, Aminata began her business by her own initiative. She has run several small businesses (sale of clothes, shoes, blankets, soaps, and spices) and in addition to these businesses she currently resells firewood and charcoal. She has been in this business for 25 years.

In order to increase her business funds to meet the demands of her customers, Aminata turned to Soro Yiriwaso. She has partnered with them for the last 60 months, with 2 group loans and 4 individual loans all having been fully repaid. She is on her 5th individual loan which she plans to use to purchase 2 loads of firewood and 1 load of charcoal. She stocks up in the same location. Aminata sells on a cash and credit basis to a customer base made up mostly of women. 

She hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 50,000 francs CFA, which she will use to repay the loan and to help her husband with the family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase firewood and charcoal

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Madame  Fatoumata  est âgée de 64 ans,  mariée  et mère de 2 enfants, elle vit dans une famille nucléaire  avec son mari et  ses enfants au quartier Bagadadji de Ségou  (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas fréquenté l’école pour des raisons sociales, car issue d’une famille traditionaliste Dogon, elle commença très tôt à  mener le petit commerce seule. Les activités génératrices elle l’effectue  depuis 25 ans et jouit d’une grande clientèle et expérience. Sa force de vente est due à la qualité de son riz Gamiaka très prisé des consommateurs. En plus elle reçoit fréquemment  de la commande de son voisinage mais également de Bamako où elle dispose d’un vaste réseau de  clientèle. 
Dans  le but d’augmenter son fonds de commerce afin de faire face à la demande clientèle, elle a fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est en relation avec cette dernière depuis 48  mois,  après 2 prêts solidaires et 2 prêts individuels bien remboursés. Elle  est à son 3ème   prêt individuel qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter 1 tonne de riz. Elle s’approvisionne à Niono. 
Madame   Fatoumata  vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée  de femmes majoritairement. Elle espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 70.000 FCFA, qui lui sert à rembourser son prêt et à aider son mari  dans la prise en charge des dépenses familiales. Son ambition est de diversifier son activité.
texts.en:
Fatoumata is 64 years old, married, and the mother of 2 children. She lives in a nuclear family with her husband and children in the Bagadadji neighborhood of Ségou (the fourth administrative region of Mali.) Not having attended school for social reasons, due to being in a traditional Dogon family, she began conducting her small business independently at an early age. She has been in business for 25 years and enjoys a large customer base and has the benefit of extensive experience.

Fatoumata's strength in her business is due to the quality of her Gamiaka rice, highly popular with consumers. In addition, she often receives orders from her neighbors and also from Bamako where she has a large customer base. In the hope of increasing her business funds in order to meet her customers' needs, she turned to Soro Yiriwaso. Fatoumata has been in a partnership with them for 48 months, during which time her 2 group loans and 2 individual loans have been fully repaid.

Fatoumata is on her 3rd individual loan which she plans to use to purchase 1 ton of rice. She stocks up in Niono, and sells for cash and credit to a customer base made up mostly of women. Fatoumata hopes to earn a monthly profit of 70,000 francs CFA, which she will use to pay back her loan and to help her husband care for the family's expenses. Her dream is to expand and diversify her business.

loans.use: to purchase rice

loans.name: Cevero

texts.es: Cevero de 40 año es un hombre soltero sin hijos y con una vivienda propia construida  a base de material noble comparte sus vivencias familiares junto a sus hermanos y padres. Cevero se dedica a la venta de gaseosas y productos comestibles en una tienda en el primer piso de su hogar. Desempeña su negocio con ayuda de familiares que lo apoyan ya que se caracteriza por tener una familia muy unida. Su actual negocio le permite ofrecer a los clientes diversa variedad de bebidas heladas tales como gaseosas, cremoladas; entre otros, así como golosinas y otros que tiene una buena demanda en los que acuden a su negocio. Este es su tercer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Para esta ocasión requiere contar con 2,000 nuevos soles para la compra de gaseosas al por mayor y golosinas tales como galletas y caramelos que tienen alta demanda en su negocio.
texts.en:
Cevero at 40 years old is single and has no children. He lives in his own solidly constructed house which he shares with his parents and siblings. Cevero sells soft drinks and food products in a store located on the ground floor of the family house. He carries out his business with the help from family members who support him as it is a very close family. His business offers a good variety of cold drinks such as pop and "cremoladas" (almost a slushie but with real fruit pulp) etc. as well as candy and other things that are in demand by his clients who come to his store. 

This is Cevero's third loan with Kiva and he will use the 2000 PEN to buy soft drinks wholesale and candy such as cookies and caramels which are in high demand in his store. He is grateful for the financial assistance that allows him to get ahead and promises to pay his installments on time.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, cookies and candy.

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Madame  Fatoumata est âgée de 31 ans,  mariée  et mère de 3 enfants, elle vit dans une famille traditionnelle  avec son mari et   ses enfants au quartier Hamdallaye de Ségou  (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Ayant abandonné l’école âpres la classe de 9ème année fondamentale (système éducatif malien) pour se marier, elle commence à faire le commerce d’habits de seconde auprès d’une parente, après quelques moment d’apprentissage elle évolue seule depuis 2 ans, sa force de vente est due à la qualité de sa marchandise mais également à son prix préférentiel que celui de ses conquérants. Elle dispose d’un vaste de clientèle composée de revendeur. 
Dans  le but d’augmenter son fonds de commerce afin de faire face à la demande clientèle, elle  fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est  à son 1er    prêt individuel qu’elle utilisera pour acheter 2 balles d’habits de friperies. Elle s’approvisionne sur place. Madame  Fatoumata vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes majoritairement. Avec ce prêt elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75 000 FCFA, qui lui sert à rembourser son prêt et à aider son mari  dans la prise en charge des dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
Fatoumata is 31 years old, married, and the mother of 3 children. She lives in a traditional family with her husband and children in the Hamdallaye neighborhood of Ségou, the fourth administrative region of Mali. Having left school after her 9th year (in the Malian system) in order to get married, Fatoumata began a second-hand clothes business, first as an apprentice to her parent's business and then on her own for the last two years. 

Fatoumata's business success is due to the quality of her merchandise but also to her competitive prices compared to the competition. She has a wide customer base made up of resellers. With the goal of increasing her business funds to meet the demands of her customers, Fatoumata turned to Soro Yiriwaso. She sells for both cash and credit to a customer base made up of mostly women.

With this loan, Fatoumata hopes to earn a monthly profit of 75,000 francs CFA, which she will use to pay back the loan and to help her husband provide for their family's expenses.

loans.use: to purchase second-hand clothes

loans.name: Bunafsha

texts.ru:
Милая девушка из Курган-Тюбе - Бунафша работает продавщицей на местном рынке. Мимо ее очаровательной улыбки невозможно пройти. Ей 26 лет. Она любит радовать глаза покупателей своим высококачественным товаром. Бунафша продает персики, абрикосы, яблоки, груши, гранаты и другие виды фруктов. Вставая рано утром она идет за новым товаром на Дехкан базар, чтобы успеть приобрести фрукты и положить на прилавку. Бунафша пунктуальная, она не заставляет своих клиентов ждать. Уже осень на дворе и настало время для осеннего урожая. 
Бунафша берет кредит для покупки фруктов, чтобы запастись. Средства кредита пойдут на приобретения осенних и зимних фруктов. Таджикистан известен своими натуральными и вкусными фруктами. От изобилия различных фруктов, ягод и овощей невозможно оторвать глаза. И Бунафша хочет это изобилия показать на своей прилавке.
texts.en:
Bunafsha is a lovely young woman from Qurgan-Tube who works as a clerk at the local market.  It is impossible to pass by without noticing her beautiful smile.  She is 26 years old.  She loves to please the eyes of her customers with high quality goods.  Bunafsha sells peaches, apricots, apples, pears, pomegranates and other types fruit.  She wakes up early and walks to the Dehkan bazaar to get new product and to arrange it on her stand.  Bunafsha is very punctual, she does not make her clients wait.  

It is already fall outside, a time for the harvest. Bunafsha is taking out a loan to purchase fruit to replenish her stocks.  The loan will be used to purchase fall and winter fruit.  Tajikistan is famous for its natural and delicious fruit.  One cannot tear their eyes away from the abundance of different fruits, berries and vegetables.  Bunafsha wishes to show this abundance at her market stall.

loans.use: To purchase fruit so she can replenish her stocks for the winter.

loans.name: Unificada Ii Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “UNIFICADA II” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Felicidad es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de barrio, producción de mantillas, venta de objetos de plásticos, carnicería, venta de pipocas, atención de parqueo, tienda de abarrotes.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Felicidad es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio tienda de barrio; da a conocer que este negocio lo instalaron ella y su esposo al observar la necesidad de sus vecinos, implementaron este negocio ya que ellos querían generar nuevos ingresos.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de aceite, azúcar, fideo, arroz) que adquirirá de las ferias tradicionales, por mayor, y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene siete hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito y el área de salud.
texts.en:
The A.C. “UNIFICADA II” will start their first phase with Pro Mujer at the Senkata Focal Center. It is made up of eight members and is governed by a board of directors and Felicidad is the President. 

There are several different businesses among the community association members. Some of the businesses are: neighborhood store, blanket maker, selling plastic objects, butcher, popcorn vendor, valet and grocery store. 

The loan will help the small business owner members such as Felicidad. She joined Pro Mujer a year ago. She joined through the invite of a friend who was a member of the institution. 

Currently she owns a neighborhood store. She tells that her and her husband started the business when they noticed the needs of their neighbors. 

They started the business to generate new income. 

The loan will be used to increase capital (buy oil, sugar, beans and rice) that they will buy at traditional fairs, wholesale and then sell it in their store. 

This type of work allows her to create an income to help support her family since she is married and has seven children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the loan and the health area.

loans.use: buy oil, beans, rice

loans.name: Nguyet

texts.en:
Nguyet was born in 1993 and is from a family of five. She lives in Dong Anh. Nguyet is pictured with her mother.

Nguyet is a Korean major at Hanoi University (http://www.hanu.vn/). She is the first person in her family to study in college. Nguyet is passionate about her major because she wants to have opportunities to communicate with international friends. Her degree is four years and she will graduate in 2015. 

Nguyet's parents subsidize her education costs. Her mother is a seller and her father is a worker. Her family’s total income is about 7,000,000VND per month. Nguyet plans to find a part-time job to earn money for her education costs and support her parents. After graduating, she can earn money for her family, improve her family’s living standards, and contribute to her country’s development. She is requesting a 10,206,000 VND loan to pay for her education costs. 

Nguyet sincerely thanks donors and SEDA. SEDA's program has supported both Nguyet's education and the education of Vietnamese youth generally. She hopes this program can be expanded to support more students.

loans.use: to pay her education costs

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia tiene 29 años es una mujer que vive junto a su esposo y su hija de 8 años en su casa propia. Posee una parcela donde  produce cacao orgánico ya que es uno de los productos con mayor demanda en su zona. Por su lado se caracteriza por ser una persona muy trabajadora ya que según comenta su familia tiene ese don.
Lleva 3 años a cargo de de esta labor y siempre lo ha hecho con mucha energía. Desempeña su trabajo con apoyo de su pareja quien desde siempre realizar esta labor con la mayor dedicación posible. Para el normal desempeño de sus actividades requiere contar con capital para la compra de abono orgánico el cual es necesario para que sus plantaciones obtengan una producción de calidad al finalizar cosecha. Al finalizar la campaña productiva vende sus productos a los compradores del lugar y esto le permite obtener buenos ingresos en recompensa al esfuerzo aplicado. Este es su segundo préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
En esta oportunidad contar con 2,000 nuevos soles para la compra de abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Delia is a 29 year old woman who lives with her husband and eight year old daughter in their own home. She has a plot of land where she grows organic cocoa which is one of the products in high demand in her area. She claims she is hard-working and her family says she certainly is. She has done this for three years and has put a lot of effort into it. 

Delia carries out this labor along with her husband who has always worked with great dedication. To properly carry out this activity you have to have the capital to buy organic fertilizer, which is necessary to achieve a quality product come harvest time. At the end of the growing season she sells the product to local buyers. This allows her to obtain good income as recompense for all the labor involved. 

This is Delia's second loan with Kiva and this time she will use the 2000 PEN to buy organic fertilizer. She is grateful for the financial support which allows her to get ahead. She promises to pay her installments punctually.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Hamida

texts.ru: Хамида 40 лет. Она вдова и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Она является единственной кормилицей семьи. Хамида уже несколько лет работает в больнице в должности бухгалтера. Она работает упорно и качественно. Хамида всегда мечтала, чтобы ее дети получили высшее образование. Двое из ее детей учатся в университете. Хамида должна оплатить за учебный договор своих детей и с такой целью она обратилась за займом. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 7500 сомони для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Hamida is 40 years old.  She is a widow who is raising three children.  She is the breadwinner in her family.  For a number of years, Hamida has been working as an accountant at a hospital.  She works hard and efficiently.  Hamida has always dreamed that her children would receive university education.  Currently, two of her children are studying at the university.  

Hamida is asking for a loan to pay for her children's education.  She needs 7500 somoni to pay for the university tuition costs.  She is waiting for your kindness and is hoping for your generosity.

loans.use: to pay for her children's university tuition.

loans.name: Lasmi

texts.en:
This is the story of Hartini, daughter of Lasmi:

I chose accounting because I am sure this will bring me toward my dream. Making a new adaptation with new conditions at school is maybe a little bit hard for me, but it’s ok. I can overcome. Some fun things for me are having many friends and studying with friendly teachers. 

I would like to thank the Kiva program. My family was helped, so I can continue my study in spite of my family being poor. 

My hometown is Brebeg village, Jeruklegi subdistrict, Cilacap Regency, Mid Java Province, Indonesia. The roads around my village are bad, with many holes, muddy and rocky. It’s difficult to pass by. My parents are farmers. Their salary is low and not enough to fulfill the needs of us. Their salary is around Rp. (Rupiah) 200,000 per month. 

The number of children in my family are six. They are Lasimin (35 years old), Lasinah (33 years old), Haryati (29 years old), Turiman (26 years old), Endang Susiati (19 years old), and me (16 years old). I am the only child who is studying at school. With this loan, I can go to school again, and I hope I can reach my dream. My family is very grateful to Kiva.

In this school, I will study about accounting lessons. I want to get a job as an accountant and can help my parents.

loans.use: to pay for education fees at the vocational school.

loans.name: Fazeelat

texts.en:
Fazeelat is 52 years old and married, the mother of five children.  She and her family live in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.  

She is very talented and excellent at sewing.  She sews for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to a lack of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. 

For this reason, Fazeelat has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan. She intends to use this loan to buy packs of lace, zippers, and buttons, and more spools of thread in different colors. In this way she will be able to sew more dresses on time to generate a healthier source of income. 

She is in her sixth loan cycle, and she has a good repayment history. She hopes to expand her business in the near future to meet her household expenses more efficiently. 

Fazeelat says thank you to Kiva and to its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy lace, spools, needles, zippers, and buttons for tailoring.

loans.name: Bayarsaikhan

texts.en:
Mr. Bayarsaikhan, who is 55 years old, lives with his wife in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. They have two adult children; both of them moved out and live with their own families. 

Bayarsaikhan has been working as a driver for 32 years and enjoys his job. His wife works at a hospital. 

He is requesting a loan of MNT 700,000 to purchase planks to fence his land. He is extending his land by purchasing a neighbor's land.  He is planning to grow vegetables on his extended land next year.

loans.use: to purchase planks to fence his land for a vegtable garden

loans.name: Hun's Group

texts.en:
Residing in Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Hun is 32 years old and married. She is a breadwinner in a family consisting of five children who are in school. Her business counts on a well-known cash-crop of the local area, cassava and cashew farming. This is a business she had for 14 years.

With this new loan, she and her co-borrower are fourth-cycled clients with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and are seeking 1,400,000 KHR each. 

As the leader, Dambae will spend her loan portion to plow her farmland and buy insecticide for it. Additionally, she will spend some portion of it to pay for labor cost for her farmland. 

She hopes to gain a good yield from her crop so that she can triple her income and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to plow her farmland, buy insecticide for it, and pay for labor cost.

loans.name: Señor De Lagunas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SEÑOR DE LAGUNAS” iniciará el décimo primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Máxima es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de chinelas, venta de comida, venta de chuño, venta de celulares, venta de joyas, venta de pollo, tejido de mantas, venta de ferretería.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Máxima es integrante, ella indica que hace quince años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su padre que es socio de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de papa; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su hermana , quien comercializaba el mismo producto, cuenta que al iniciar la venta inicio con un capital de 100:- mismo que fue ampliando con los créditos que realizó en Pro Mujer
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de papa) que adquirirá de las ferias tradicionales, por mayor, del departamento de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito y el ahorro.
texts.en:
The “SEÑOR DE LAGUNAS” communal bank is in their eleventh cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes regional office. It is made up of eight members, lead by a Board of Directors, with Máxima as President. The members have a variety of business amongst which are: the sale of slippers, the sale of "chuño (dried potatoes), cell-phone sales, selling jewellery,  the sale of chickens, sewing blankets, and selling hardware. The loan will help all these micro-entrepreneurs.

Máxima says that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for fifteen years, joining on the invitation of her father who was also a member of the institution. Currently she has a business selling potatoes. She says she learned the business from her sister who sells the same product. She started selling with a capital of 100 BOB. This was amplified by the loans that she's received through pro Mujer.  

The loan that Máxima is currently requesting is to increase her capital (buying potatoes) which she buys at the traditional markets, wholesale, in the department of La Paz. She then sells them in her commercial space. This allows her to generate the resources needed to support her family. She is married and has five children. When asked what she liked about Pro Mujer her reply was that she liked the loans and the saving.

loans.use: to buy potatoes.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
This is Marie. She previously accessed a 12,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in their personal, household, and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 8,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Marie dreams that her business will flourish more and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets with her co-fellowship members* every week to share stories of her life and business, and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages to stock her variety store.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is 48 years old.  She is married and blessed with four children.  Her eldest is now working as a chemical engineer and is able to help her with school fees of his three siblings.  The family lives in South Western Poblacion, Calamba Misamis Occidental, in the Philippines.

Hannah engages in her small tailoring business. She has been in this business for more than 10 years now, earning a monthly income of PHP 3,200. 

She has requested a new loan to purchase materials to be used in dressmaking and also for maintenance expense. 

She became a CUMI member of Paglaum MPC just last year. She is striving hard to earn more.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies and materials used for her tailoring.

loans.name: Phen

texts.en:
Phen, aged 51, lives in his own house with his spouse and seven children in Kampong Thom province. He is a very responsible and hard-working father.

He has made a living in agriculture and in sourcing and purchasing hair for beauty uses.  From his effort and perseverance, he can make a net profit of KHR 16,000 per day. His wife also helps in him in the same businesses.

Phen has applied for a loan to increase his capital for the purchase of hair, which he will sell to local hairdressers for their needs.    

With the loan, he will be able to continue with his work, improve his income, and give his family more financial stability. Phen thanks lenders for their constant support. He awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to increase his capital for the purchase of hair, which he sells to local hairdressers.

loans.name: Noeme

texts.en:
Noeme is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  Noeme is borrowing 18000 PHP (Philippine pesos) through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Noeme has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Myra

texts.en:
This is Myra, 39, resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Eduardo, a driver, and they have children. She, together with her husband, manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Myra operates a piggery. She earns by selling live hogs to meat dealers. Sometimes they have the pigs slaughtered and sold in the market. Aside from this, she also cooks breakfast meals for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,200 in sales every week.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy feeds and additional hogs. 

Myra's dream is to expand her business, and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy feeds and additional hogs.

loans.name: Hina

texts.en:
Hina is 35 and is living with her husband.
Her husband is a service provider; he provides the light decoration services on marriage, birthday and engagement ceremonies. His business does not work well because this is a seasonal business. In the off season he works over at an electrician shop and provides the services of troubleshooting electrical components for the customers. In the off season the decoration lights remain unused and become out of order.
Now the marriage ceremony season is going on and he does not have decoration lights to provide services. 
Therefore, Hina requested a loan for her husband so that he could buy new decoration lights to provide the decoration services. 
Hina says thank you to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy decorative light strings.

loans.name: Borbandi

texts.en:
Mr. Borbandi, 38 years old, lives with his wife and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been selling firewood to local people since 2008. His wife stays at home looking after their youngest child. Their eldest son goes to high school and the second one is being educated in kindergarten. 
Borbandi is requesting a loan of 4300000 MNT (Mongolian tugrik) to purchase firewood in large quantities from a lumberjack so that he can continue to sell firewood without worrying about inventory shortage. Borbandi is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better life.

loans.use: to purchase lumber

loans.name: Miriam De La Paz

texts.es: Doña Miriam, es habitante de un barrio muy pobre de Managua, actualmente tiene bajo su cargo a dos de sus hijos quienes estudian en colegios públicos, su mayor deseo es que ellos terminen una carrera profesional. Miriam es una persona emprendedora, hacia comida y vendía pero le  fue mal por lo que ahora se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de manera ambulante. Solicita el crédito para invertir en mejorar su hogar ya que este presenta deterioro en el techo en la parte principal de la sala y también pondrá cerámica en el piso, con el financiamiento comprara materiales como láminas de zinc, perlines, cemento, cerámica y el pago de mano de obra.
texts.en: Doña Miriam lives in a very poor neighborhood of Managua. She now has two of her sons, who are in public elementary schools, in her care. Her greatest wish is that they finish studying for careers. Miriam is an entrepreneurial person. She was making food and selling it, but it went badly for her, so now she sells cosmetics as a street vendor. She is applying for the loan to invest in improving her home, since the roof is now deteriorated in the main part of the house, and she will also put tile on the floor. With the loan, she will buy materials such as sheets of zinc, purlins, cement, and tile, and also pay for labor.

loans.use: to buy materials such as zinc sheets, purlins, cement, and tile, and pay for labor

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
This is Evelyn, 37, a resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Antonio, her business partner, and a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Evelyn operates a repacking business. What she basically does is buy different products from wholesalers, repacks them and sells them for profit. Her regular customers are neighbor and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of garlic, pepper, laurel and other seasoning to expand her product inventory. 

Evelyn hopes to expand her business and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more quantities of garlic, pepper, laurel, and other seasonings to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Alfredo Luis

texts.es:
Alfredo de 30 años, desde hace un año emprendió su propio negocio: él muy observador de la realidad comunitaria, se dio cuenta que las personas no contaban con máquinas de lavar y que este servicio, que mejora los tiempos de trabajo de las amas de casa, no existía en su barrio. Así fue como a falta de competencia, se dedicó a alquilar lavadoras en su propio barrio, ubicado en el municipio de Soledad, a 15 minutos de la ciudad principal, donde habita con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 3 y 5 años de edad. 
A Alfredo sus clientes lo llaman por teléfono, para solicitarle el servicio de alquiler de lavadoras y él,  lleva las máquinas a la residencia de cada familia, que lo contrata por horas. Su trabajo es intenso y lo realiza de lunes a domingos, desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde y sus principales clientes son sus propios vecinos, quienes le remiten nuevos compradores de servicios de lavandería. Su meta mas adelante, es extender su ruta hacia otros sectores que aun no cuentan con ese servicio, pero su capacidad de respuesta no es suficiente para lograrlo. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará  nuevas lavadoras, para responder poco a poco a la demanda potencial del mercado, porque su mayor desafío es la competencia y el gasto en la reparación de sus antiguas máquinas.
texts.en:
One year ago, Alfredo, 30, launched his own business. Being very observant of life in his community, he realized that residents didn't have washing machines and that this service, which lessens the workload of housewives, did not exist in his neighborhood. So it happened that, in the absence of competition, he started to rent out washing machines in his own neighborhood. His neighborhood is located in the municipality of Soledad, 15 minutes away from the main city where he lives with his spouse and two children, aged 3 and 5. 

Alfredo's clients call him by telephone to request his rental washing machine service, and he brings the washing machines to each family's residence where he is paid by the hour. His job is intense and he works from Monday to Sunday from 7AM until 6PM. His main clients are his own neighbors, who send new clients to his rental washing machine service. His future goal is to extend his route towards other sectors that still don't have this service, but his response capacity is not sufficient enough to achieve this. This is the reason why he is turning to a Kiva loan: the first loan that he is taking out from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With this loan, he will buy new washing machines in order to gradually respond to the potential market demand because his greatest challenge is competition and the expense of repairing his older machines.

loans.use: to buy new washing machines.

loans.name: Odmaa

texts.en:
Mrs. Odmaa, 37 years old, lives with her husband and children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in an old house on a plot of land. She has been running a grocery store since 2003. Her husband renders taxi service to local people. 

They moved to their house 10 years ago and since that time, never made any renovations to their house. So, she is requesting a loan of 7,000,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to purchase vacuum-insulated windows, hardwood floors, fiberglass and cement. Using those materials, her husband will make renovations to the old house, thus creating a comfortable and warm place. In this energy-preserving house, heat loss will be minimal, and the family will burn less coal for heating, thus releasing less pollutants into the atmosphere.

loans.use: to purchase building materials for renovating the old house.

loans.name: Momela (One) Group

texts.en:
Merina, who is in her mid 30s, is married with two children who are still going to school. She has been a food vendor for 10 years now. She works from 6 am to 10 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This is her 12th loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy more food inventories and has paid back all her previous loans successfully. With the business profit earned,she has been able to cover school fees and household expenses. She also used the money to buy a mattress, TV, radio, saucepans for her business and a plot of land.  

Merina will use this loan to increase the food stock for her food stall. She dreams of one day owning a big hotel servicing more people. 
She will share this loan with her loan group "MOMELA (one)" which totals seven members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase their food stock.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica offers bananas and operates a general store within her locality. She is 35 years old and married to a manufacturer of charcoal. Veronica has almost five years in the business, and she has been able to improve it since the very beginning. Veronica’s children currently go to school.

Veronica plans to invest her income from the business to be able to support her children's education. Last time, Veronica borrowed 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) for the improvement of her general store. The generated income was used to renovate her house. Now, she is asking for another loan amounting to 12,000 PHP to buy stock of merchandise such as spices, snack foods, breads and drinks. 

She and her husband will continue to work hard in order to obtain their plans and earn higher income than her usual profit. In this way, they could let their children finish their studies and have a better way of living.

loans.use: to buy stock of merchandise such as spices, snack foods, breads and drinks for her general store.

loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
Saima is a 35-year-old married woman living with her five children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband has four rickshaws which he has given to the drivers on daily wages. They committed over mutual understanding on specific daily wages, and it is decided that the drivers will only drive the rickshaw, and the owner will be responsible for all depreciation. Nowadays, two rickshaws are badly depreciated and need a healthy amount for repairing. A little bit of maintenance he can fix through his daily income, but this time he is facing extraordinary depreciation, and he does not have a healthy amount to fix the problem.

Therefore, Saima requested a loan for her husband so that her husband could fix the problem of both rickshaws. Saima is very thankful to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of two auto rickshaws.

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en:
Abdul lives in Punjab, Pakistan with his family. He is the only working person in the family. He owns a sewing machine shop in the market where he offers both types of sewing machines, electric and non-electric. He finds he has an insufficient variety to offer, and therefore he cannot attract many customers. He wants to add more variety in the shop. However, due to a lack of money he finds it difficult.

Therefore, he has requested a Kiva loan from Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase more machines for the shop. This will not only help him to attract more customers, but to increase his net income and savings as well.

Adbul wants to thank all Kiva lenders for their kindness.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of sewing machines to sell.

loans.name: Leonides

texts.en:
Leonides is married to a welder and she has four children. She operates a tailoring services in their own home, which is located in the village of Aurora in Zamboanga del Sur to make a living. She has been in this business for thirty years, earning at least twenty thousand a month aside from other activities that she earns money from. 

She wants to borrow a loan from Gata Daku MPC to repair sewing machines used in the business and buy additional textiles. An amount of 40,000 PHP will make her business improve and run smoothly. Her hope is to expand the services to gain more profit for the future needs of her family.

loans.use: to repair sewing machines used in the business and buy additional textiles

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for more quantities and varieties of bags to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Aydee

texts.es: Aydee tiene  30 años y vive junto a su esposo y su hija en su casa propia construida a base de adobe. Aydee se dedica a la agricultura al lado de su pareja en un terreno de 1 hectárea, el cual le heredaron sus suegros por estar a la espera de su menor hija. Tiene conocimientos sólidos sobre agricultura porque creció en el campo junto a sus padres aprendiendo así este humilde oficio que también sostiene económicamente a muchas familias de su región. Para mejorar la calidad de su producción fertiliza sus terrenos de cultivo con abono orgánico. Le agrada mucho participar en la cosecha ya que tras el secado correspondiente de sus productos los lleva hasta los centros de venta ubicados en su localidad donde recibe a cambio una buena ganancia que le permite justificar el dinero que invirtió en la campaña productiva. Este es su tercer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En esta ocasión desea contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para la compra de abono orgánico al por mayor.
texts.en:
Aydee is 30 years old and lives together with her husband and daughter in their own adobe house. Aydee works in agriculture along with her husband on a 1-hectare plot of land, which she inherited from her parents-in-law and which is being held in wait for her young daughter. She has solid knowledge about agriculture, as she grew up in the fields next to her parents learning this humble job that also economically sustains many families in her region. 

In order to improve her production quality, she fertilizes her cropland with organic fertilizer. It is very pleasing to her to participate in the harvest. After the corresponding drying of her products, she takes them to the sales center located in her community, where she receives excellent earnings in exchange, which allows her to justify the money that she invested in the productive season. 

This is her third loan with Kiva, and she feels grateful for the financial support that she receives in order to get ahead. In addition, she is committed to paying off her quotas in a timely manner. This time, she is hoping for 1,000 nuevos soles to purchase wholesale organic fertilizer.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer in bulk.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 44 years old and married with two children.

Sarah works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy items like egg, sugar, shampoo, spices, and other groceries.

Sarah has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 22 years and also earns an income from clothing sales.

Sarah aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items like egg, sugar, shampoo, spices, and other groceries.

loans.name: Asernal Group

texts.en:
Ritha, who is a married woman with two daughters, is in her early 30s. Her children are still in school. Ritha is a businesswoman running two projects:  selling fried pork and managing a fruit and vegetable business. She has been in these activities for seven years now. She starts working at 06:30 am until 9 pm daily and is able to make good monthly returns. 

This is Ritha's third loan from Kiva partner Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy more pork which she sold to more people. She has paid back all her previous loans successfully. Ritha's business profit is used to cover school fees for her daughters. She also used it to buy more bricks for her house construction. She will use this loan to buy more pork to resell. Ritha is doing great in her businesses. She dreams that one day she will be able to finish building her house. 

Ritha will share this loan with her loan group "Asernal" which consist of 14 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more pork to resell.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 58 years old, married and engages in selling native cakes as well as hog raising.  Her husband is a farm laborer in their village. The couple has been blessed with four children; three are married and the eldest is still single. Teresita sells her native cakes using her bicycle with a cart. She sells them around her village and nearby villages. Usually, she is able to sell her native cakes before lunch time, after which, she had nothing to do, so she decided to engage herself in hog raising. 

At her age, Teresita is getting older and she aims to make her businesses stable. For her dreams to be realized, she requests additional capital of PHP15,000 which allows her to buy hog feed to ensure proper nutrition for her pigs. Teresita is optimistic about the future.

loans.use: to buy hog feed

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 58 years old and married with 3 children. Teresa works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requests a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Teresa has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as rice, soap, sugar, spices and other groceries.  In the future Teresa would like to save money to expand her business and renovate her house.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.en:
This is Gregorio. His previous loan was a big help in his business. He was able to buy more fish nets and scouring pads for his business. His loan also helped in sending his children to school. The income from his business assisted in their everyday expenses at home. He has been in this business for ten years now. He and his wife are helping each other to provide for their everyday expenditures.

He would like to apply for a 16,000 PHP loan for him to buy more fishnets and scouring pads needed in his business. The profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain his family's daily needs and educational expenses of his children. He looks forward to this expected profit with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Gregorio hopes that his business will grow bigger and dreams to have their own house and lot. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of his work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more nets and scouring pads needed in his business

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
Mr. Muhammad is a 55-year-old married man and active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. He lives in Punjab, Pakistan. His wife is a very hardworking and responsible housewife.

Since 2000, Mr. Muhammad has been selling curtains. Which is the only source of income for his family. He purchases a variety of curtains from different areas and sells them in the local market. 

Currently, he is in need of replacing old varieties with new ones. However, due to financial constrains he finds this difficult. For that reason, he has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. This will not only help him to attract more customers but will increase his net income and savings as well. He desires to provide quality education to his children. He is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan

loans.use: To purchase a variety of curtains to sell

loans.name: Nusrat's Group

texts.en:
Nusrat is 40 and the mother of 7 children. Her husband owns a shop in which he has 4 compression molding machines. He takes orders for manufacturing plastic bottles, toys, small bicycle wheels, and plastic accessories. He appoints laborers to operate the  molding machines and pays them daily. For the manufacturing of different plastic accessories he needs different categories and quality of raw material. This time he has taken a larger contract than before but does not have enough capital to buy good quality crushing plastic to continue his manufacturing. 
Therefore, Nusrat requests a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband would be able to buy crushing plastic raw material for his business. 
Nusrat has to look after a huge family, she has to take care of her each child, their school fees, their diet and their health. For these purposes she needs income and his husband is the only person who is responsible to bear household expenses. 
Nusrat is very happy after taking this loan and thanks Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan. She belongs to this group of 2 borrowers.

Note: Nusrat is in the red dress in the given picture.

loans.use: To buy crushing plastic for his business

loans.name: Marfina

texts.en:
Marfina is happy for the life that she has. She is married and owns a sari-sari store. According to her, the only business she had before this was a farm which was not enough to meet the basic necessities of her family and send her three children to school. With her situation, Marfina did not stop believing that someday she would be able to overcome these trials.

Marfina is grateful because her three children finished their college education and have degrees. All of them are now working abroad in accordance with their own profession. Marfina admits that she receives remittances from her children but she doesn’t want to rely on them. Instead, she wants to have her own source of income for which she can gain profit. Marfina requests a loan of PHP 17,000 to buy shampoo, toothpaste, conditioner and seasonings. She hopes that the amount she requests will be granted for her to earn profit to deal with emergencies that may arise in the family.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, toothpaste, conditioner and seasonings for her variety store

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 61 years old and widowed with eight children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Evelyn is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Evelyn has been farming rice for 40 years and also earns additional income from a general store. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is 58 years old and married with four children.

Estrella works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requests a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase snack food, bread, coffee, laundry soap, soft-drinks, etc. to sell in her general store.

Estrella has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns additional income from selling gasoline. Estrella aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase snack food, bread, coffee, laundry soap, soft-drinks, etc. to sell in her general store

loans.name: Warlito

texts.en: Warlito runs a cafeteria in his village in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. He has three children and is still studying. For ten years, he has managed this business and wants to improve it in order to gain more profit. He requests a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients and pots for his cafeteria. His ultimate dream is to build a house to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients and pots for his cafeteria

loans.name: Ran's Group

texts.en: Ran is a rural villager in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is 43 years old and has one child. To support her family, she raises pigs as the main source of her family’s income and works as a paid worker who taps rubber trees to collect latex at a rubber plantation as supplementary income. Having been in this business for 25 years, she can earn about 41,700 KHR per day. Ran has never been with VisionFund before. Now she and her co-member are applying for 500,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will use her loan to buy pig feed to nourish her pigs. She hopes to fatten them in a healthy condition so as to sell them for a good price to better her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy pig feed

loans.name: Candelaria Obe

texts.es: Doña Candelaria, oriunda del departamento de Beni, tiene tres hijos, cuatro nietos y un bisnieto, viuda hace seis años atrás, ella ya cumplira sus 60 años, pero a pesar de la edad se mantiene sana, fuerte, trabajadora y sobre todo una señora muy amable y responsable. Doña Cande, como se hace llamar ya viene radicando en la poblacion de Chimore unos treinta años aproximadamente, cuenta ella, junto con su esposo compraron una casita que tiene un atractivo turistico (La Laguna), trabajaron juntos en beneficio de su familia, pero lamentablemente perdio a su esposo. Desde entonces ella siguio trabajando, con el cuidado de niños y la venta de comida. Sin embargo ella ya quiere llevar una vida mas tranquila, por eso es que solicita el credito para la refaccion de los cuartos que tiene y ponerlos en alquiler para tener unos ingresos fijos, ya que ella no cuenta con un jubilación y sus hijos radican en la ciudad de Cochabamba.
texts.en: Candelaria is originally from the department of Beni. She has three children, four grandchildren, and a great-grandchild. She became a widow six years ago and has already turned sixty, but in spite of her age she is still healthy, strong, hardworking, and above all a very kind and responsible woman. Cande, as she is called, says she has been living in Chimore for approximately thirty years. She and her husband bought a little house which has a tourist attraction (La Laguna) and worked together to help her family, but sadly she lost her husband. Since then she has continued to work, looking after children and selling food. However, she now wants to have a more peaceful life; for this reason, she is requesting a loan to refurbish the rooms she has and rent them out to obtain fixed income, as she does not have a pension and her children live in the city of Cochabamba.

loans.use: to refurbish the rooms of her house

loans.name: Liliam Inés

texts.es: Liliam, a sus 58 años de edad es madre soltera de 2 hijos. Desde hace aproximadamente 35 años conoció el campo de la confección y poco tiempo después realizó un curso de alta costura, con el que perfeccionó sus conocimientos y su técnica. Gracias a ello, vio en este campo una oportunidad de negocio rentable, por lo que decidió iniciar su propio taller de confección el cual se encuentra ubicado en la casa donde reside; desde allí presta el servicio a terceros, hace trabajos y arreglos de modistería y además confecciona sobre medida algunas prendas que solicitan sus vecinos. En la actualidad tiene contrato con una gran empresa a quien le produce las bolsas de empaque para lo cual cuenta con el apoyo de 3 personas que le colaboran con la terminación de este producto. Liliam es una mujer activa, emprendedora, pujante y perseverante, se motiva a solicitar el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de una máquina industrial plana, con la que podrá agilizar su proceso de producción y tendrá la posibilidad de tener más contratos, aumentando así los ingresos que percibe para continuar velando por el bienestar de su familia ya que toda la carga económica recae directamente sobre ella. Liliam sueña con darle continuidad a su negocio, acreditarlo y hacerlo más rentable, para que el margen de utilidades le permita comprar su casa propia y poder disfrutar los frutos de su ardua labor y una mejor calidad de vida al lado de sus hijos.
texts.en: 58-year-old Liliam is a single mother to two children. Approximately 35 years ago she learnt dressmaking and shortly afterwards she did a course in haute couture, in which she perfected her knowledge and technique. Thanks to the course, she saw an opportunity for a profitable business in this field, so she decided to start her own dressmaking workshop. It is located in her home, from which she offers service to third parties, does design work and mending and makes clothes to measure for her neighbours. She currently has a contract with a big business; she collaborates with three other people to produce packing bags for said business. Liliam is an active, enterprising, thriving, and persevering woman. She is requesting the loan in order to invest it in purchasing an industrial flat-bed sewing machine, with which she will be able to accelerate her production process. Then she will have the opportunity to have more contracts, thereby increasing her income and enabling her to continue looking after her family’s welfare. The financial responsibility rests directly on her. Liliam dreams of giving continuity to her business, getting it accredited, and making it more profitable so that the profit margin will allow her to buy her own house and enjoy the fruits of her hard labour and a better quality of life with her children.

loans.use: to purchase an industrial flat-bed sewing machine

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.ru: Насиба трудолюбивая женщина. Ей 41 года. Она вдова и имеет 2 детей. Насиба является единственной кормилицей своих детей. Она работает в больнице. Она заботливая мать своих детей, которая старается для благополучия своих детей. Ее сын Абдулатиф учится в Медицинском Университете в Российской Федерации. Он является успешным студентом 1 курса. Насиба запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора своего сына. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Nasiba is a hardworking, 41-year-old woman.  She works in a hospital, and, as a widow with 2 children, is the only breadwinner in the family.  She is a caring mother to her children, and tries her best to provide for them.  Her son Abdulatif is in his freshman year at medical university in the Russian Federation, and is getting along well with his studies.  She is requesting a loan to pay for her son's tuition, and is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for her son's university tuition

loans.name: Muazzam

texts.ru: Муаззам трудолюбивая и целеустремленная женщина. Она родилась в 1969 года. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Муаззам более 5 лет работает в больнице в должности медицинской сестры. Она любит свою работу и выполняет успешно свою функцию. Муаззам является основной кормилицей семьи, так как ее муж не имеет постоянное место работы. Ее муж собирается уехать в Российскую Федерацию, для того, чтобы найти место работы и подрабатывать. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2500 сомони для покупки авиабилета. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Muazzam is a hardworking, goal-oriented woman.  She was born in 1969, is married, and is taking care of 3 children.  For more than 5 years, Muazzam has been working in a hospital as a nurse.  She loves her job, and does it well.  Muazzam is the main breadwinner of the family  as her husband does not have a consistent place of work.  Her husband is preparing to go to the Russian Federation to find work and earn extra money for the family.  Muazzam is requesting a loan in the amount of 2500 somoni to buy a plane ticket for her husband, and is counting on your kindness and charity.

loans.use: to buy a plane ticket for her husband

loans.name: Sebastian

texts.es: Sebastian tiene 24 años, es padre soltero de una niña de 9 años con quien vive en una casa construida a base de adobe. Desarrolla actividades agrícolas en el campo con la producción de cacao y café orgánico, desde hace 5 años, comenta que fue gracias a unas parcelas  que compró a un buen precio junto a otros agricultores en una zona que posee terrenos muy fértiles en las afueras de la ciudad. Desempeña su labor con el apoyo de trabajadores del lugar quienes le brindan todo el apoyo del caso en cuanto a actividades colectivas se refiere logrando de esta manera culminar las labores cotidianas referentes al mantenimiento y cuidados a sus distintas plantaciones en menor tiempo. No obstante la temporada de lluvias es una época en donde las tareas de mantenimiento se ven afectadas por el lodo y caminos resbalosos. Al hallarse en medio de de una campaña productiva desea fertilizar sus terrenos de cultivo con abono orgánico, asimismo contratar trabajadores para llevar a cabo el segundo retiro de maleza de entre sus plantaciones. Este es su tercer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En está ocasión desea contar con 3,000 nuevos soles para comprar abono orgánico y así nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en: Sebastian is 24 years old, single, and father to a nine-year-old daughter, with whom he lives in a house built from adobe. He has done farming work in the country, producing organic cacao and coffee, for five years. He says this is thanks to some parcels of land he bought together with some other farmers at a good price in an area on the outskirts of the city which has very fertile land. He does his work with the help of workers from the area, who give him all their support as far as group work is concerned, managing in this way to finish the daily work of maintenance and caring for the different fields in less time. However, the rainy season is a period in which maintenance work is affected by the mud and slippery paths. Finding himself in the middle of a productive season, he wishes to fertilize his cropland with organic compost and contract workers to carry out the second weeding of his fields. This is his third loan with Kiva and he feels grateful for the financial support he receives so he can get ahead. He is also committed to making his repayments on time. On this occasion he wishes to borrow 3,000 PEN in order to purchase organic compost to nourish his seedlings.

loans.use: to purchase organic compost

loans.name: Ulukoy

texts.ru: Улукой родилась в 1958 года. Она замужем и имеет 4 детей. Ее сын Хуршед учится в Новосибирском Медицинском Университете по специальности терапевт. Улукой и ее муж стараются, чтобы их дети получили высшее образование и стали высококвалифицированными специалистами. Улукой запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора своего сына. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Ulukoy was born in 1958.  She is married and has 4 kids.  Her son Khurshed is studying to become a doctor at Novosibirsk State Medical University.  Ulukoy and her husband work very hard to ensure that their children are able to get a university education and become highly-qualified specialists.  She is requesting a loan to pay for her son's university tuition, and is counting on your kindness and charity.

loans.use: to pay for her son's university education

loans.name: Matluba

texts.ru:
Матлюба родилась в 1962 года. Она вдова и имеет 2 детей. Она более 20 лет занимается шитьем женской одежды. Матлюба шьёт как национальные одежды, так и европейские одежды. Она имеет большой опыт. Матлюба является основной кормилицей семьи. Матлюбе помогает ее невестка по введению бизнеса. Матлюба должна провести свадебное торжество своей дочери, но не имеет достаточно денег. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 сомони для проведения свадебного торжества дочери. Она ждет вашу доброту.
Этот займ поможет Матлюбе осчастливить ее дочь.
texts.en: Matluba was born in 1962. She is a widow and has two children. She has been sewing women's clothing for over twenty years. Matluba sews traditional Tajik as well as European style clothing. She has a good experience. Matluba is a main provider for the family. Her daughter-in-law helps her in the business. Matluba has to hold a wedding ceremony for her daughter, but does not have enough money. She is asking for a loan in the amount of 1,000 somoni to hold a wedding party for her daughter. She is waiting for your kindness. This loan will help Matluba to make her daughter happy.

loans.use: to hold a wedding party of her daughter.

loans.name: Kamal

texts.ru: Камалу 51 год, женат, вместе с супругой воспитывают 8 детей. У Камала- высшее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Камал занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 18 лет назад, с покупки скота на 50,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Камала, в его хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы. Ежемесячный доход составляет 16,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Камал обратился в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Камал планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Kamal is 51 years old and married. Together with his wife, he is raising 8 children. Kamal has a university education. As the main source of income for his family, Kamal practices animal breeding and crop farming, starting this business 18 years ago with a 50,000 som (KGS) purchase of cattle. Thanks to Kamal's hard work, he currently has two dairy cows on his farm. His monthly earnings are 16,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop his business, Kamal turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners." He is requesting a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy cows in order to increase the size of his herd. Kamal plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the future accrual of more livestock.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Albina

texts.es: Albina tiene 66 años, es viuda y tiene dos hijos con quienes vive en su casa construida a base de adobe. Albina se dedica a la agricultura, posee unos terrenos en las afueras de su localidad el cual logró adquirir con la ayuda de sus padres. Aprendió el oficio de la agricultura gracias a sus padres quienes le enseñaron esta labor desde muy niña junto a sus hermanos por ser una tradición familiar. Tiene mas de 40 años de experiencia en el rubro iniciándose  junto a su esposo, pero tras su muerte, ella se convirtió en el único sustento de su familia. Su labor principal consiste en brindarle un cuidado adecuado a las plantaciones de cacao, café y achiote que tiene en sus terrenos de cultivo ya que puede obtener buenas ganancias por la venta de estos productos. Cuando finaliza la campaña productiva de cada producto  contrata trabajadores del lugar y algunos familiares que acostumbran apoyarla en la cosecha para culminar la recolección de los productos maduros en menor tiempo. Este es su tercer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante. En está ocasión desea contar con  4,000 nuevos soles para comprar abono orgánico y pagar a trabajadores del lugar.
texts.en:
Albina, 66, is widowed and lives together with her two children in a house made of adobe. Albina works in agriculture and owns a piece of land located on the outskirts of her village. Her parents helped her acquire this land. They also taught her about agriculture when she was a small girl, together with her siblings; it is the family’s tradition.
