She has more than 40 years of experience in this activity. She started working with her husband, but when he died she became the family’s main support. Her job is to give maintenance to her cocoa, coffee and achiote plantations, which leave her good profits.

When each crop’s harvesting season is over, she hires local laborers and some relatives to help her collect the ripe produce more quickly. This is her third loan with Kiva and she appreciates the financial support she is receiving to get ahead. This time, she is requesting 4,000 nuevos soles [PEN] to buy organic fertilizer and to pay for the labor.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Ertay

texts.ru: Эртаю 34 года, холост, проживает с родителями. У Эртая- среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Эртай занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 14 лет назад, с покупки скота на 60,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Эртая, в его хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 1 теленок, 40 овец, 1 лошадь. Ежемесячный доход составляет 16,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Эртай обратился в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку лошади для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Эртай планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на проведение своего свадебного торжества.
texts.en: Ertay is 34 years old, he is not married and lives with parents. Ertay has secondary education and is doing animal husbandry and field crop cultivation as a main source of income for his family which he started fourteen years ago with the purchase of cattle for 60,000 som (KGS). Thanks to his hard work Ertay now has one milk cow, one calf, forty sheep and one horse. His monthly income is 16,000 som. With the goal to further grow his business Ertay has come to the microfinance bank Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 70,000 KGS to buy a horse to increase the headcount of livestock. He plans to invest the income from the loan into further increase of the livestock and plans to save some money to hold a wedding for himself.

loans.use: to buy a horse.

loans.name: Nuriza

texts.ru: Нуризе 37 лет. Совместно с супругом растят троих детей. В 2007 году, супруги начали бизнес в торговле продуктами питания, используя в качестве стартового капитала сумму в 30,000 сом (KGS). Сумев развить свой бизнес и обретя постоянных клиентов, Нуриза имеет среднемесячный доход в сумме 5,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду в бизнесе, супруги смогли купить скот. В целях дальнейшего увеличения и расширения своего бизнеса, Нуриза обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) для оптовой покупки продуктов питания, для дальнейшей розничной продажи населению. Доходы от кредита Нуриза планирует вложить в увеличение товарооборота и накопить деньги на обучение в университете для своих детей.
texts.en: Nuriza is 37 years old. Together with her husband, they are raising three children. In 2007, the married couple started a business selling food products, using 30,000 som (KGS) of start-up capital. Having developed her business and gained loyal customers, Nuriza has an average monthly income of 5,000 som (KGS). Thanks to the hard work put into the business, the married couple have been able to purchase cattle. To increase and expand their business in the future, Nuriza turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum and Partners." She is requesting a loan in the amount of 20,000 som (KGS) for the wholesale purchase of food products for retail sales to the community.  Nuriza plans to invest the earnings from the loan to increase sales and save money for her children's college education.

loans.use: to buy food production for resale

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es: El Sr. Humberto vive en la comunidad de Colomi, tiene 32 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, económicamente es independiente, se dedica a la agricultura siembra en terreno de 2 Has herencia de sus padres produce papa, papaliza y haba, con rotación de cultivos con experiencia en el rubro, además cuenta con cabezas de ganado 3 de engorde y 2 lecheras. El Sr Humberto requiere el crédito para la compra de abono orgánico y compra de semilla de papa, ya que se requiere estos insumos por la época de siembra en estos meses de agosto a octubre, ya que el ahorro que tenia lo invirtio en compra de terreno agricola. Por último Humberto se sintió contento al tener la oportunidad de acceder al crédito, además de poder contar con la ayuda de la institución porque con la compra de abono orgánico y la semilla de papa ya tiene asegurado la siembra de papa y otros productos para la seguridad alimentaria y generar mejores ingresos a futuro.
texts.en:
Humberto lives in the community of Colomi.  He is 32, single and economically independent.  He earns a living farming two hectares of land which is his inheritance from his parents.  He produces potatoes, olluco (a type of tuber) and broad beans, with crop rotation.  He has a lot of experience in this field.  He also has three heads of cattle for fattening and two dairy cows.

Humberto needs a loan to buy organic fertilizer and potato seed for the planting season, which lasts from August through October.  He used his savings to buy farm land.

Humberto is glad to be able to receive the loan and to count on help from the institution.  Buying the fertilizer and potato seed will give him the assurance of being able to plant potatos and other crops and of earning more income.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer and potato seeds.

loans.name: Aydee

texts.es:
Aydee tiene  30 años, vive junto su esposo Reynaldo y sus 2  hijos en su casa propia construida a base de adobe. Aydee se dedica a la agricultura, desde hace 14 años cultiva cacao orgánico junto a su pareja  en unos terrenos que le cedieron sus padres para poder mantener económicamente a su familia.
Se desempeña en esta labor hace más de  14 años y se siente a gusto con el trabajo que realiza ya que es una actividad que aprendió desde muy niña. Cuando fue joven se comprometió con Reynaldo siendo desde entonces su mano derecha en la constante labor que realiza manteniendo en buen estado las plantaciones de cacao que existen a lo largo de sus áreas cultivables. Al iniciar su primera campaña productiva no le fue bien ya que las mazorcas de cacao que brotaron no tenían un peso adecuado logrando recuperar con algo de suerte el capital que invirtió en aquel entonces, es por ello que tras recibir la asesoría técnica por parte de otros agriculturos de su zona realizó distintos cambios tales como la renovación de varios árboles cacaoteros desfasados y usar abono orgánico. Con el tiempo desea poner en su vivienda un pequeño negocio para la venta de productos comestibles para así obtener ganancias adicionales en su trabajo. Este es su cuarto préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En esta ocasión desea contar con  1,000 nuevos soles para la compra de abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Aydee, 30, lives with her husband, Reynaldo, and their two children in the adobe home that belongs to them.  Aydee is a farmer and has been growing organic cocoa for 14 years, together with her husband.  The land they use is what her parents gave them to maintan the family.  Aydee likes the work she has because it is something she learned when she was a little girl.  When she got engaged to Reynaldo they worked hand in hand on the constant job of maintenance and caring for the entire cocoa plantation.  At the beginning of their first crop season things did not go so well because the cocoa cobs did not have the adequate weight; so they were luck to get back any of the capital they had invested.  After receiving technical assistance from other farmers in the area, they made changes and removed some of the obsolete cocoa trees and began using organic fertilizer.

In the future, Aydee would like to open a small grocery store in her house to earn extra income.  This is her fourth loan through Kiva and she is grateful for the financial support that helps her prosper.  She is committed to paying back the loan on time.  She will use the 1,000 PEN loan to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
Claudia es una mujer de 41 años, está casada con Alejandro y tiene 2 hijos con quienes vive en su casa construida a base de adobe. Claudia se dedica a la agricultura en unos terrenos que logró adquirir junto a su esposo desde muy joven ya que tenía la responsabilidad de mantener a sus pequeños hijos. Actualmente cuenta con 3 hectáreas de cultivo repletas con árboles de cacao que es su principal oficio junto a su esposo y que también logra mantenerlos en buen estado con ayuda de trabajadores del lugar.
Realiza esta actividad hace mas de 20 años logrando así ganar experiencia ya que a lo largo de estos años ha lidiado con muchos inconvenientes tales como el ataque de plagas que peligraron sus producción y condiciones climáticas desfavorables. Este es su cuarto préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En esta ocasión desea contar con 3,000 nuevos soles para la compra de abono orgánico al por mayor.
texts.en:
Claudia is a 41 year old woman. She is married to Alejandro and they have 2 children with whom they live in a house built from adobe. Claudia farms on some land she was able to acquire with her husband when she was very young, since she already had the responsibility of caring for her children. Right now she has 3 hectares full of cacao trees, which is her main work with her husband. They are able to keep them in good order with the help of some workers from the area. 

She has been doing this activity for more than 20 years. She has gained experience, since through the years she has dealt with a lot of problems, such as pests attacking their crops and unfavorable weather conditions. This is her fourth Kiva loan and she is grateful for the financial support that she is receiving to get ahead. She is also committed to making her payments on time. At this time, she wishes to have 3,000 nuevos soles to buy organic fertilizer wholesale.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es: La Sra. Sabina vive en la comunidad de Colomi, tiene 51 años de edad, de estado civil casada, económicamente junto a su pareja perciben ingresos de la actividad agrícola, siembran en terreno de 3 Has, producen papa, papaliza y haba, con rotación de cultivos con experiencia en el rubro. La sra. Sabina solicita el crédito para la compra de abono orgánico, compra de semilla de papa y productos agroquímicos, ya que se requiere estos insumos por la epoca se siembra en estos meses de agosto a octubre. Comentar que con el crédito la Sra. Sabina podrá realizar la siembra correspondiente y asegurar sus ingresos para el siguiente año, además de contribuir con la seguridad alimentaria a nivel regional.
texts.en:
Sabina lives in the communiyt of Colomi.  She is 51, married and earns a living farming, together with her husband.  They have three hectares of land where they grow rotational crops such as potatoes, olluco (type of tuber) and broad beans.  They have a lot of agricultural experience.

Sabina is requesting a loan to buy organic fertilizer, potato seed and agrichemical products since she needs the supplies for the planting season between August and October.  Sabina says the loan will allow her to do the planting and insure an income for next year.  She will also be contributing to the regional food level.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer, potato seed and agrichemical products.

loans.name: Dúo Las Torrelianas Group

texts.es:
Duo las Torrelianas

Orfa de 40 años de edad es casada tiene tres hijos ( 4,8,12) se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva por mayor y menor, ella inicio su negocio hace dos años cuando perdió su empleo y se vio en la necesidad de tener un ingreso para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, ella inicio vendiendo una docena de camisetas y una docena de pantalonetas actualmente distribuye su mercadería por mayor a sus acreedores, actualmente lleva cuatro meses en los que esta vendiendo cosméticos por catalogo, ella solicita el crédito para poder comprar los cosméticos al contado y que sus ganancias aumenten, el sueño mas grande que ella tiene es tener su propio local para no tener que seguir vendiendo ambulante.
texts.en:
The Las Torrelianas Duo

Orfa is 40 years old. She is married and has three children (4,8 and 12). She sells new clothes wholesale and retail. She started her business two years ago when she lost her job and had to have income to help her husband with the household expenses. She started selling a dozen t-shirts and a dozen pair of pants. Now she distributes her merchandise wholesale to her customers. She has been selling cosmetics via catalog for four months. She is asking for the loan to buy the cosmetics upfront for her profits to increase. Her biggest dream is to have her own locale so she doesn't have to sell as a street vendor.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 53 years old and married with 1 child.
She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Evelyn is asking for a loan of PHP 5000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm tools.
Evelyn has been farming rice for two years and also earns additional income from pig fattening.
She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm tools.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more pork and cheese.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a 58-year-old man who is married to Grace and they have four children.

He has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru for three years and has applied for a third loan from Kadet Ltd to enable him buy fertilizer, seeds and a sheep. He plans to start a cloth selling business with anticipated profit.

In the near future, he hopes to improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and a sheep.

loans.name: Dúo Manos Trabajadoras Group

texts.es: Dúo Manos trabajadoras, este grupo esta conformado por la señora Glenda de 39 años de edad,ella se dedica a la venta gas propano negocio que gracias a Dios le ha ayudado mucho a salir adelante y tener nuevas oportunidades en lo personal, en esta oportunidad ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de cilindros de gas propano ya que desea inverti un poco mas y agrandar su negocio esperando que por medio de ustedes ella pueda optar a un credito y seguir luchando para superarse cada dia mas.
texts.en:
One of the members of the communal bank "Dúo Manos Trabajadoras" is Glenda, 39, who sells propane gas for a living.  Thanks to this, she has been able to get ahead and have new opportunities in her personal life.  

On this occasion, she is requesting a loan to buy propane gas cylinders because she wants to invest a little more and expand her business.  She hopes that you can help her with the loan so she can continue improving her situation day by day.

loans.use: To buy propane gas to sell.

loans.name: Clotilde

texts.es:
Clotilde tiene  30 años, esta casada con Teodoro y tiene 3 hijos con quienes vive en su casa construida a base de adobe. Clotilde se dedica a la agricultura junto a su esposo en unos terrenos de 2 hectáreas.
Se inicio en esta labor hace mas de 10 años luego de tener al primero de sus hijos quien la hizo sentir mas motivada para iniciar con está actividad. Comenta que su primera campaña productiva fue decepcionante ya que no contaba con dinero suficiente para contratar trabajadores del lugar retrasando las tareas pendientes que la obligaron a obtener algunas ganancias básicas. Actualmente posee plantaciones de cacao orgánico que mantiene en buen estado con la ayuda de abono orgánico. Su principal objetivo es comprar otro terreno de una hectárea para iniciarse en producción de barbasco ya que los terrenos de su localidad también favorecen   al buen creamiento de este producto. Este es su cuarto préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En esta oportunidad desea contar con 2,500 nuevos soles para la compra de abono orgánico.
texts.en:
30-year old Clotilde is married to Teodoro and has three children. They live in their own adobe house. Clotilde and her husband are farmers and have 2 hectares of land. She started this work more than ten years ago after having her first child. That event motivated her to begin farming. 

She says that her first harvest was disappointing as she didn't have enough money to pay laborers. Various tasks got delayed resulting in minimal profits. Nowadays Clotilde has fields of organic cocoa which she keeps in good condition with the help of organic manure. Her main goal is to by another hectare of land and start growing barbasco [a product used to stun fish] as it grows well in the area.

This is Clotilde's fourth loan with Kiva and she is grateful for the financial assistance which helps her make progress. She promises to pay back the money punctually. She plans to use this loan of 2,500 soles to buy organic manure.

loans.use: buy organic manure

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
Elsa de 31 años de edad, es madre soltera de 2 hijos con quienes vive en su casa construida a base de madera. Elsa se dedica a la agricultura en unos terrenos que logró adquirir con ayuda de quien fuera el padre de sus hijos cuando fue joven. Inicialmente contaba con la ayuda de su entonces pareja y tras su separación se vio en la obligación de mantener sola a sus hijas. Posee una cantidad considerable de árboles que producen mazorcas de cacao ya que sus parcelas son muy fértiles contando también con el apoyo de trabajadores del lugar.
Comenta que siempre es necesario contar con dinero para solventar los gastos típicos de su labor como es la compra de abonos y el pago a su personal de apoyo, logrando recuperarlo cuando finaliza la campaña productiva vendiendo sus productos a los acopiadores del lugar. Este es su cuarto préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante. En esta oportunidad desea contar con  2,000  para comprar abono orgánico y pagar a los trabajadores del lugar que contrata para la cosecha de sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Elsa is 31 years old. She is the single mother of 2 children with whom she lives in a house built from wood. She works in agriculture on some land she acquired when she was young with the help of the man who was the father of her children. At first she had the help of her then spouse and after her separation she had to support her children alone. She has a considerable amount of trees that produce cacao pods, since her land is very fertile. She also has the help of some area workers.

She says that she needs to have the money to pay for normal expenses such as buying fertilizer and paying for the personnel. She can recover the costs when she finishes the growing season, selling to area warehouses. This is her fourth loan with Kiva and she is grateful for the financial support that she is receiving to get ahead. At this time, she wants to have 2,000 to buy organic fertilizer and to pay for area workers she hires to harvest her crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and to pay for area workers.

loans.name: Ma. Cecilia

texts.en:
Ma. Cecilia is a 46-year-old married woman with eight children. Five of her children are still in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Ma. Cecilia has a buy and sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines. Ma. Cecilia requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of ready-to-wear.

Ma. Cecilia has been in this business for 5 years. Ma. Cecilia would like to save enough money to continue to afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of ready-to-wear.

loans.name: Arsen

texts.en:
Arsen and his family live in Vanadzor which is in the Lori region. He lives with his wife and two children. The only source of family income is the fruit-vegetable trade that he has been engaged in the last four years. In his own car he drives around the city and sells a great variety of vegetables (tomatoes, cucumbers, greens, cabbage and potato) and fruits (apples, peaches, plums, pears, strawberries, etc.). The products that he sells he buys from local wholesale markets. His wife helps him greatly in his business. Profits from the fruit and vegetable trading allow Arsen to meet his family’s needs.
Arsen is asking for a loan of 320,000 Armenian drams in order to buy a large supply of vegetables and fruits, which will allow him to distribute vegetables and fruits to different food markets.

loans.use: to buy a large supply of vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Maria Blanca

texts.es: La señora María Blanca es una señora de 33 años de edad, está casada, ambos tienen un grado de instrucción de nivel primario, tienen tres hijos. La señora María Blanca es costurera con una experiencia de 19 años, trabaja con su maquina de costura, confeccionando y arreglando todo tipo de prendas de vestir. También se dedica a la venta de pan todas las madrugada por el centro de la cuidad. Su  esposo es Obrero en el departamento de Mantenimiento en una empresa, ambas personas tienen muchas ganas de superarse, por esa razón es que necesitan realizar una refacción y construcción, ya que su vivienda se encuentra dañada por las lluvias y por el paso del tiempo,  actualmente tienen un cuarto en proceso de construcción que no pudieron concluir porque el señor tubo un accidente el año 2012, ahora que esta estable el señor piensa concluirlo, por esa razón es que solicita el crédito.
texts.en:
Sra. María Blanca is 33 years old and married with three children. She has primary level education. She has been a seamstress for nineteen years and uses her sewing machine to make all kinds of clothing. 

María Blanca also sells bread every morning in the town centre. Her husband works in the maintenance department for a company. Both are very keen to make progress in life, and for this reason they want to do some work on their house which was damaged in the rains; it is also old. They currently have a room under construction which they could not complete because the señor had an accident in 2012. Now that he is stable again, María Blanca would like the repairs and construction finished. For this reason she is seeking a loan.

loans.use: complete repairs and construction on her house

loans.name: Angela

texts.en: Angela is a 37-year-old married woman. She has five children, ranging from 5 to 15 years old. She describes herself as aggressive. She operates a beauty salon where she offers hair-braiding services. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in a market center and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge as high electricity costs. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy hairpieces. Her business goal is to have a larger salon within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be a successful businesswoman. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy hairpieces.

loans.name: Satenik

texts.en: Satenik is 32 years old and she lives with her family in the village of Gosh, which is in the Tavush region. Satenik is married and has three daughters. Her husband at this moment is working abroad in the Russian Federation. Satenik has graduated from the state university of Ijevan from the department of history. Now she works as a teacher at the local school. Despite being alone, she manages farming and agricultural activities. She cultivates beans and corn. She breeds two cows and 20 chickens. Satenik is a hardworking woman. She asks for a loan of 600,000 AMD and hopes to receive Kiva lenders' support in order to buy several piglets and some animal fodder. She already has a good credit history in Nor Horizon; she has never been late on her loan payments.

loans.use: to buy several piglets and some animal fodder.

loans.name: Plutarca

texts.en:
Plutarca is 56 years old and married with five children. With one child still in school, Plutarca works very hard to provide for them.

Plutarca runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Plutarca has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as detergent soap, shampoo, sugar, soft drinks, canned goods and other groceries. 

Plutarca would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 59 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Lucia is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF in order to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Lucia has been farming rice for 40 years and also earns additional income from selling dried fish.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, which is to save enough money to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Phally's Group

texts.en: Phally is married and a mother of six children, all of whom are still in school. She is a resident of the Dambae district in the Kampong Cham province of Cambodia. Phally and her husband manage two hectares of farmland where they grow paddy rice and cassava as their primary source of income. She and one of her co-borrowers are first-time borrowers whereas the remaining two borrowers are second-time borrowers with VisionFund (Kiva's partner). In a group of four, Phally is the leader. The total amount of her entire group loan is 3,600,000 KHR. As the leader, Phally will use her loan portion to buy fertilizers and insecticides, and to pay for plowing as well as the labor fees. She hopes to gain a good yield from her crop so that she can keep her children in school until the tertiary level.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and insecticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Laila

texts.en:
Laila's guiding principle in life is “What you sow is what you will reap”. She does everything to give her children a better future and obtain greater profits some day.

Laila operates a retail business which involves selling grocery items in their local community. She is married and has four children who go to school. Her husband is a farmer and sometimes does construction work. 

Laila wants to expand her business to get additional income as well. Hence, she is seeking a loan of PHP12,000. This amount will be used to buy soft drinks, eggs and canned goods. The income made from her variety store will be invested for the education of her children. She hopes that her variety store will further grow continuously so she will be able to earn a greater income and let her four children finish their studies and become professionals some day.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, eggs and canned goods used in her retail business.

loans.name: Maria Adelaida

texts.es:
Doña María Adelaida tiene 40 años de edad es madre de 3 hijos los cuales viven bajo su mismo techo y están estudiando. Ella es agricultora y ama de casa la cual se dedica desde hace muchos años al rubro del cultivo de papa el cual aprendió por medio de su pareja siendo el agricultor por generaciones. Ella tiene un grado de educación primaria no completado cursado hasta el cuarto grado ya que sus padres de escasos recursos no pudieron ayudarla a continuar con sus estudios. El terreno que ellos como familia trabajan no es propio por lo que ellos actualmente alquilan pero el terreno donde está ubicada su casa da gracias a DIOS por él ya que es propio pero no tiene mucho espacio para cultivar sus hortalizas. Sus clientes son los diferentes intermediarios que llegan a la zona en busca de un producto de calidad y a un precio cómodo para su reventa. 

Sus sueños a futuro son los de poder comprar un terreno para poder cultivar sus hortalizas y no andar alquilando esto traerá mejores ganancias para su familia y podrá apoyar y aportar más a la economía de su hogar como también apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios. por lo que ella actualmente está solicitando un financiamiento con el cual comprara insumos agrícolas como abono, fertilizantes, foliares y semilla certificada de papa la cual utilizara para cultivar.
texts.en:
40-year old Sra. María Adelaida has three children who live with her. They are students. María Adelaida has been a farmer and housewife for many years. She grows potatoes, a job she learned from her husband whose family have been farmers for generations. María Adelaida only completed grade four education as her parents were poor and could not pay for any more schooling. 

The land that the family works is not their own. They rent it but thankfully it is located close to their home which they are pleased to own. However, there isn't anywhere for growing the vegetables which they sell to various customers who come to the area looking for quality produce and fair prices so they can resell it.

María Adelaida's dream for the future is to be able to buy land where they can grow vegetables and not have to rent. This would lead to greater earnings for the family and financial support for the household. She would also be able to support her children through school.

For these reasons she is seeking a loan to buy agricultural supplies such as manure, fertilizer, sprays, and special certified seed potatoes for her fields.

loans.use: buy agricultural supplies and certified seed potatoes for her fields

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 47 years old. He is married to Dorothy and they have five children who are in school.

He is in a shoe-selling business in Naivasha which he has operated for two years and has applied for first loan from Kadet Ltd. to enable him buy shoes and school bags. With the anticipated profit, he plans to pay school fees.

In the near future, he hopes to expand his business and see his children well-educated.

loans.use: To buy shoes and school bags.

loans.name: Turqueza Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “TUQUEZA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Elena es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de barrio, venta de perfumes, venta de herramientas, venta de chompas, venta de papa y venta de ropa.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Elena es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de perfumes; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace un año de una amiga quien le enseñó a realizar los contactos necesarios para la compra de perfumes
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de perfumes) que adquirirá de las distribuidoras, por mayor, del departamento de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en:
Communal bank “Turqueza” will start its first cycle with Pro Mujer, in the focal center of Los Andes. This group is composed of eight members and run by a board, of which Elena is the president. The group’s members have different activities, such as a grocery store, perfume sales, tools sales, sweaters sales, potatoes sales and clothes sales.

The loan they are requesting will be beneficial for micro entrepreneurs like Elena. She says this is the first time she works with Pro Mujer, and joined invited by a friend who is a member. Elena sells perfumes and says that she started a year ago when a friend taught her how to find the right contacts to run the business.

The loan she is requesting is to buy perfumes. She will buy them from wholesale distributors in the department of La Paz, and then sell them upon request. This activity helps her to receive an income to support her family. She is married and has a son. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the health department.

loans.use: to buy perfumes to sell.

loans.name: Santusa

texts.es: Santusa vive en la ciudad de Paucartambo, ella es una persona  trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces su actividad económica principal es la venta de productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche y otras cosas mas  entonces ella tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su domicilio, ella es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Camino al Progreso” y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar y otras cosas más, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Santusa lives in the city of Paucartambo.  She is a hardworking and enterprising individual who helps her family get ahead through her work efforts.  Her main business activity is selling basic necessities such as rice, sugar, noodles, milk, and other products.  She has a small grocery store in her home.  She is a responsible person, which is why she was invited to participate in the Communal Bank “Camino al Progreso” (Road to Progress).

She is taking this opportunity to request a loan in order to buy merchandise such as sacks of rice, sacks of sugar, and other products.  She is grateful for and values this loan, so she promises to complete her monthly payments with great responsibility.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and other products.

loans.name: Salvador

texts.es: Salvador tiene 77 años de edad y vive en la hermosa ciudad de Patria junto con su pareja y tiene ochos hijos, él es una persona emprendedora y trabajadora que sale adelante con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación pues su actividad económica principal es la venta de comida pues tiene un pequeño restaurante en su domicilio. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo, él pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Huanca de Patria” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar, fideos, carne, verduras y así aumentar su capital de trabajo en este rubro. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad. (El poblado de Patria se destaca por el comercio de productos de la selva, así como servicios de alojamiento y restaurantes. Patria es una ciudad de ingreso al Parque Nacional del Manu.)
texts.en:
Salvador, 77, lives in the beautiful city of Patria with his spouse; he has 8 children.  He’s an enterprising, hardworking person who gets ahead with much effort and dedication.  His main economic activity is selling food for he has a small restaurant at home.  He’s been in this business for several years now and does very well thanks to the effort he puts into it.

He belongs to the “Señor Huanca de Patria” communal bank and on this occasion needs the loan to buy supplies like sacks of rice, sacks of sugar, noodles, meat and vegetables to increase working capital in this line of work.  He’s grateful for and values the loan and commits to make his monthly payments very responsibly.

(The town of Patria is noted as a commercial center for jungle products as well as for lodging services and restaurants.  Patria is a gateway city to Manu National Park.)

loans.use: to buy ingredients and supplies.

loans.name: Aziza

texts.ru: Азизе 36 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Азизы- высшее образование, работает в местной школе-преподавателем,  в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи Азиза занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 10 лет назад, с покупки скота на 30,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Азизы, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 дойные коровы, 2 лошади, а также имеет земельный надел размером 1,16 ГА, на которой она ежегодно выращивает: кукурузу, клевер, картофель. Ежемесячный доход составляет 13,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Азиза обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для откорма с последующей реализацией на рынке по высокой цене. Доходы от кредита Азиза планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на строительство нового сарая с навесом для содержания скота.
texts.en: Aziza is 36 years old, married and, together with her husband, is raising four children. Aziza has a university education and she works in a local school as a teacher. As the main source of income for her family, Aziza practices livestock breeding and crop farming. She started this business 10 years ago, with an initial purchase of cattle in the amount of 30,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Aziza's hard work, she currently has on her farm: 4 dairy cows and 2 horses, as well as a 1.16 hectare plot of land, on which she annually grows corn, clover and potatoes. Her monthly earnings are 13,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her farm, Aziza turned to Microcredit Bank "Bai Tushum and Partners." She is requesting a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy cows to fatten them up for resale on the market for a good price. Aziza plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also plans to save money for the construction of a new barn with an awning for housing her cattle.

loans.use: to buy cows for resale

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is married to Nathan with three children. Mary is a permanent resident of rural Mukono district in Nabuuti Lower zone.

Mary operates a salon that she started in 1999 with an initial working capital of 400,000 UGX. It has gradually grown and is currently using an operating capital of approximately UGX 2,000,000.

Mary applied for a loan of UGX 2,000,000 purposely to boost her business by buying two new hairdryers and adding more cosmetics to the business which will enhance her service. However she faces challenges of high rent cost, competition from neighbouring salons and reduction in sales, especially during holidays. She is however optimistic that the boost from the loan will help her  to attract more customers.

loans.use: To buy new hairdryers and more cosmetics

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is 26 years old and not yet married.  He has a bakery business in Naivasha that he has operated for three years. 

 Wilson has applied for his third loan from Kadet Ltd to enable him to buy flour. With the anticipated profit, he plans to expand his business.

In the near future, he hopes to have the biggest bakery in Naivasha.

loans.use: To buy flour and expand his bakery

loans.name: Jelisa

texts.en:
This is Jelisa, 51, a resident of Silang, Cavite, in the Philippines. She is single, and she manages her house while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Jelisa operates a tailoring business. She mainly offers curtains, bed sheets, blankets, and other home trappings.  Demands for clothing like uniforms and such are available all year round. She also does repairs and alterations. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread, and other items needed in her business. 

Jelisa dreams of having another branch and becoming rich someday. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their lives and business every week.  There she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet weekly. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use:
To pay for fabric, cloth, thread, needles,
 and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a single mother of three children, who are in school.

She has a business selling fruit in Naivasha, which she has operated for 18 years.  

She has applied for her first loan from Kadet Ltd to enable her buy more fruit.  With the anticipated profit, she plans to pay school fees.

In the near future, she hopes to open a grocery.

loans.use: To buy more fruit to resell.

loans.name: Azemine

texts.en:
Azemine is 42 years old and married, living with her husband and their 9-year-old son in the western part of Kosovo. She is a housewife, and her husband works as a guard in a municipality, working very hard and putting in a lot of effort to generate money for the family’s needs. 

Currently, they live in an old and small apartment, which they have been planning to improve for a long time, but they could not manage to save the money to renovate and paint or paper the rooms.

Azemine is now requesting a loan in order to renovate her rooms. The loan will help her to improve the living conditions for her family. She is hoping in the future to find a job to be able to contribute to her family’s needs and reach her goal. Her goal is to save money for the family’s future. 

She is aware of the Kiva lenders, and she wants to thank all of them!

loans.use: To renovate rooms in her house

loans.name: Tigran

texts.en:
Tigran lives in Kadjaran city, which is in the Syunik region. He is married and has a large family. He lives with his wife and four daughters. 

Tigran used to be engaged in farming and agriculture when he lived in the village of Svaranc, but after moving to Kajaran he began working at the rescue squad as a redeemer. Tigran is the only bread-winner in his family, since his wife does not work and she takes care of their school-aged children and the house.

Tigran asks a loan of 300,000 Armenian drams to buy the needed school clothes and some stationery for his daughters for the coming school year.

loans.use: to buy the needed school clothes and some stationery for his daughters for the coming school year.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides and pay for labor

loans.name: Chum

texts.en:
Chum is 27 years old, married, and has no children. She has been involved in agriculture since she was very young, since her family has limited financial resources. She had to help her parents to support the family by cultivating seasonal crops such as rice and beans. 

After being married, she settled down in a new home with her spouse and, aside from farming, they have also been involved in fishing activities to support their living.

Chum’s main income relies on farming rice and fishing, so they must have enough materials to keep these businesses running. For this reason, she wanted to acquire a loan of 700 US dollars to buy a fishing boat and other materials such as net, hook and line in order to maintain her business. Her objective is to continue working and improve her standard of living. She thanks lenders for a constant support. She awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to buy a fishing boat and other materials such as net, hook and line in order to maintain her business.

loans.name: Rizalina

texts.en:
Rizalina believes that “health is wealth.”  She does not dream to be rich in treasure; instead, she aspires to have a healthy family and be free from any kind of diseases. Rizalina believes that being physically fit is very important in achieving goals in life.

Rizalina has nine children; five are married while the others currently attend school.  Her main goal is to have a stable source of income so she can support her children's education until they finish their studies.

At the age of 49, Rizalina is engaged in planting and harvesting vegetable crops for sale.  Sometimes, though, she imports vegetables from the market and sells them within her village.  Rizalina wishes a loan of PHP 12,000 to purchase more vegetables, such as beans, eggplant, and squash, from the market.

She hopes to obtain her requested loan for further growth of her fruits and vegetable business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables in the market, like beans, eggplant and squash, for her fruits and vegetables business

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza works hard to support her family. Analiza is married and has a general-store business in the Philippines.

Analiza requested a 17,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

Analiza has been in this business for three years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Analiza would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
This is Maricel. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy more ready-to-wear products for her business. She has been in this business for 15 years now. Her income from her business is helping in her everyday expenses at home. She also has a direct selling business for additional income.

She would like to apply for another 40,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan for her to buy additional merchandise like children's, men's and women's clothing. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Maricel hopes that her business will grow bigger and larger. She dreams to have a good life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. She also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional merchandise like children's, men's and women's clothing.

loans.name: Magomeni Group

texts.en:
From Tujijenge Tanzania, Fatma, who is in her early 30s, is married and has two children, a boy and a girl who are in school. For six years now, Fatma has been running a business selling clothes and cosmetics. She is also an international business woman selling clothes from Dar es Salaam to Nairobi. Working from 8am to 6pm daily, she is able to make a good return each month. 


Fatma is requesting her first loan to buy more business clothes and to repair her business premises. She dreams of one day becoming a big businesswoman. 


FATMA will share this loan with her loan group" Magomeni" which has four members. The group members will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more business clothes and to repair her business premises.

loans.name: Aracili

texts.en:
Aracili is a 34-year-old married mother of five children, three of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them. 


Aracili has been running a general store in the Philippines for three years, selling a variety of items such as snack foods, bread, soft-drinks, noodles, eggs, etc. She has requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy more goods to sell. 


In the future, Aracili would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell in her general store

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en:
Cicilia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

Cicilia requested a PHP 14,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase ingredients for her food-vending business, like meat, rice, vegetables, and spices.

Cicilia has been in this business for 12 years now. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food-vending business, like meat, rice, vegetables, and spices.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr:
Madame Mariama  est âgée de 46 ans,  mariée  et mère de 5 enfants, elle vit dans une famille traditionnelle  au quartier Médine de Ségou  (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas fréquenté l’école pour des raisons sociales, elle commença très tôt comme bon nombre des filles de son époque à mener le petit commerce auprès de sa mère lors des jours de foire de son village et environ. Après plusieurs années d’apprentissage jusqu’à son mariage. Elle continua à faire le commerce en optant pour celui de la vente d’œufs. Elle mène cette activité depuis 10 ans et jouit d’une grande clientèle et d’expérience. Sa force de vente est due à la qualité de ses  œufs qui sont grands sans cassure. 
Dans  le but d’augmenter son fonds de commerce afin de faire face à la demande clientèle, elle a fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est en relation avec cette dernière depuis 24  mois,  après 2  prêts individuels bien remboursés. Elle  est à son 3ème   prêt individuel qu’elle utilisera pour acheter 270 alvéoles. Elle s’approvisionne sur place et des fois à Bamako. 
Madame  Mariama  vend toujours  au comptant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de boutiquiers et restaurateurs. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA, qui lui sert à rembourser son prêt et à prendre certaines charges familiales. Son ambition est de pérenniser son activité.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mariama, age 46, is married and the mother of five children. She lives in a traditional family in Médine, a neighborhood in Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

Having never attended school for social reasons, she was still young when she started working as a saleswoman with her mother during fair days in her village and its surroundings, as did many young women at that time.

She was trained for several years, until her wedding. She then stayed in sales, electing to sell eggs. She's been running this business for ten years, and has a large clientele and a lot of experience. Her strength comes from the quality of her eggs, which are big and without cracks.

In order to bolster her working capital and meet customer demand, she's seeking support from Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso. She's been working with the MFI for 24 months, and obtained and repaid two loans.

She's seeking her third personal loan, to be used to buy 270 egg trays. She gets her supplies locally and sometimes in Bamako.

Mrs. Mariama always sells for cash, to a clientele comprising mostly shop and restaurant handlers. She intends to turn and average monthly profit of XOF 100'000 (ca US$ 200), to be used to repay the loan and take care of some family expenses. Her ambition is to ensure the future of her business.

loans.use: to buy 270 egg trays

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: La señora Carmen de 30 años de edad, vive con su conyugue, tienen 2 hijos, su conyugue se encuentra fuera del país buscando siempre el bienestar de su familia, la señora Carmen se dedica a la producción de leche cruda, para lo cual cuenta con 3 cabezas de ganado, 2 se encuentran en producción, 1 se encuentra preñada, para la alimentación y recolección de leche cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijos, además se dedica a trabajar medio tiempo como operadora de limpieza, trabaja de lunes a viernes, ambos muestran muchas ganas de superarse y responsabilidad en las actividades que desempeñan, el motivo del presente crédito es para poder  comprar una cabeza de ganado, de esta manera la señora Carmen podrá aumentar su producción, siempre buscando el crecimiento de sus ingresos, de esta manera podrá establecerse económicamente y podrá satisfacer todas sus necesidades y la de sus hijos que ahora están en etapa escolar y son alumnos destacados en su colegio.
texts.en:
Carmen is 30 years old, and she lives with her husband.  They have two children.   Her husband is outside of the country, always looking out for the well-being of his family.  Carmen produces raw milk.   In order to do so, she has three heads of cattle.  Two are producing, and one is pregnant.  Her children help her feed the livestock and collect the milk.   She also works part-time in sanitation.  She works Mondays through Fridays.   Both of them show a great desire to succeed and are responsible in their business activities.

The reason for this current loan is to be able to buy one head of cattle.  This way, Carmen will be able to increase her production.  She is always looking for her income to grow.  This way she will be able to establish herself financially, and she will be able to meet all of her needs and those of her children.  Her children are now school-age, and they are outstanding students in their school.

loans.use: to buy one head of cattle

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: El señor Antonio, es una persona de 51 años de edad, de estado civil casado, alcanzo estudiar hasta la primaria, vive en su propia casa de la comunidad de Tiraque, tiene cuatro dependientes económicos a cargo, los cuales son sus hijos, La actividad económica del señor Antonio es la producción agrícola, que en promedio anualmente manifiesta que realiza la venta de los siguientes productos y en las cantidades siguientes: Papa 120 cargas, Haba (verde) 40 cargas, Trigo (Grano) 10 cargas Cebada (Grano) 7 cargas. La siembra de estos cultivos lo realiza en sus propios terrenos heredados por sus padres en una superficie de 3 hectáreas los terrenos se hallan situados en la misma comunidad, los cuales cuentan con riego. Vive en una casa rustica de adobe, con este préstamo que realiza es para  la compra abono de gallinaza y compra de ganado bovino y así con la producción  en el futuro mejorara sus condiciones económicos y por tanto también la calidad de vida de sus dependientes.
texts.en:
Antonio is 51 years old and is married. He was able to study as far as primary education. He lives in his own rustic adobe house in the community of Tiraque. He is responsible for 4 economic dependents, who are his children. 

Antonio makes a living from agricultural production, which he says gives him average annual sales of the following quantities of products: potatoes (120 loads), green beans (40 loads), wheat (grain, 10 loads) and barley (grain, 7 loads). He sows these crops on his own land, an area of 3 hectares which he inherited from his parents. The land is situated in the same community and has irrigation.

With this loan he is applying for, Antonio will buy chicken manure and cattle and so with his future production he will improve his economic situation and consequently also improve the quality of life of his dependents.

loans.use: to buy chicken manure and cattle.

loans.name: Lesly Sofia

texts.es: Lesly,  tiene 35 años de edad, esta casada, tiene dos hijos y reside en el municipio de Puerto Cortes. Tiene 3 años de tener una pulpería donde vender refrescos, churros, granos básicos, carnes etc., y la venta de mercadería como ser la venta de ropa para dama y caballero ya sea pantalones, blusas, short, camisas, etc. El préstamo que solicita es por 21,000 Lempiras y es el cuarto ciclo con la institución. Este préstamo lo invertirá en la remodelación de la pulpería, va construir de madera su propio local para surtir y atender mejor a los clientes para obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en: Lesly is 35 years old.  She is married and has two children. She lives in the Puerto Cortes municipality.  For three years Lesly has had a grocery store where she sells soft drinks, basic grains, meats, and more.  She also sells merchandise such as clothes for men and women, including trousers, blouses, shorts, shirts, and the like.  Lesly is applying for a loan of 21,000 Lempira, her fourth with the communal bank.  She will invest this loan in renovating her grocery store.  She will build her own premises out of wood so as to stock it up and better serve her customers needs.  This will give Lesly a higher income.

loans.use: to buy wood, nails and other materials in order to build premises for her grocery store.

loans.name: Seke Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SEKE”  iniciará el vigésimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Silveria es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, trenzado, producción de calzados, venta de api, venta de camas y transporte.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Silveria es integrante, ella indica que hace ocho años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una asesora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años al observar en el mercado que este negocio es muy comercial.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de arroz, aceite y fideo) que adquirirá de las tiendas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y las capacitaciones.
texts.en:
The "SEKE" communal bank is starting its twentieth cycle with Pro Mujer, through the Collpani office.  This group has eight members and is run by a board of directors, the president of which is Silveria.  The members have different businesses, including businesses where they sell food, do braiding, making shoes, selling "api" (a non-alcoholic maize drink), selling beds, and providing transport services.

This loan will benefit the businesses in the group of which Silveria is a member.  Silveria tells us that she started with Pro Mujer eight years ago after one of the organisation's assessors went to visit her at her home.  Silveria currently has a business selling meals.  She started this business a few years ago after seeing that this was profitable work.

Silveria will use this loan to increase her working capital by buying rice, oil and pasta.  She will buy these products in shops in the city of El Alto and use them to prepare the meals to sell at her stall.  This type of work has allowed Silveria to earn an income to support her household.  Silveria is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer,Silveria tells us that she likes the health advice and training that is given.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, and pasta.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es: Rolando, tiene 46 años de edad, está soltero y vive con su madre y una hermana en el municipio de Choloma, Cortes. Tiene 4 años de dedicarse a la venta de mercadería. el anteriormente trabajaba en una maquila pero a la falta de empleo decidió dedicarse al comercio, vende ropa como blusas, camisetas, pantalones, bóxer, ropa intima para damas etc. El préstamo que solicita es por 10,000 Lempiras y lo va invertir en la compra de más mercadería como ser ropa para damas, caballeros y niños ya sea pantalones, blusas, vestidos, camisetas, etc. Este préstamo le ayudara a surtir mas el negocio y los clientes estarán satisfechos. Su plan es que el negocio crezca para darle una mejor vida a su madre y su familia.
texts.en: Rolando is 46 years old.  He is single and lives with his mother and sister in the Choloma municipality of Cortes.  For four years Rolando has been making a living selling merchandise.  Previously he worked in a factory but, due to a lack of work, he decided to start his own business.  Rolando sells clothes such as blouses, shirts, trousers, boxer shorts, women's underwear, and more.  He is applying for a loan of 10,000 Lempira which he will invest in buying more men's, women's, and children's clothes, such as trousers, blouses, dresses, and shirts.  This loan will help Rolando to stock up his business and his customers will be satisfied.  His plan is to expand the business so as to give his mother and family and better life.

loans.use: to buy men's, women's and children's clothes to sell.

loans.name: Battsend

texts.en:
Mr. Battsend, 72 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Darkhan, second largest city of Mongolia. He and his wife have retired from work and get a monthly state pension. 

The house they live in has deteriorated over the years and it needs some repair. So he is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to purchase building materials such as cement, fiberglass, and foam.

After renovation, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place without worrying about incoming winter. Also he will begin burning less coal for heating, thus releasing less pollutants into atmosphere.

loans.use: to purchase building materials

loans.name: Vanessa

texts.en:
Vanessa is 28 years old and married. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. 

Vanessa is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She has been farming rice for four years and also earns additional income from gasoline retailing. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 42 and married, they are blessed with 5 children aged between 18 and 5 years old. His main source of income comes from the quarry that he owns. He has been in this business for a period of over 7 years earning an income of 44,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES).

He has borrowed a fourth loan of 125,000 KES from KADET Ltd. and intends to use this amount to pay for labour costs and raw materials. The profits he earns will be used to increase his working capital to expand the current business.

His dream is to be financially stable.

loans.use: To pay labour costs and raw materials

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 51 years old and single.  

Corazon is in the agricultural business, pig-fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Corazon has been in the pig-fattening business for eight years now and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Corazon would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Fibrije

texts.en:
Thanks to Kiva lenders, Fibrije was able to stock up on inventory items with your financial help. She needs your help again this time to do the same thing, stock up on inventory items. 

Kindly note that through this activity she can barely secure the staple foods, so she can't save money to buy inventory herself. This is why your help is very precious to her.

loans.use: to stock up on secondhand shoes inventory

loans.name: Shirlet Joy

texts.en:
Shirlet Joy is 36 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Shirlet Joy is borrowing 8500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Shirlet Joy has been raising pigs for ten years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Jeroseline

texts.en:
Jeroseline is 59 years old and widowed with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Jeroseline is borrowing  5000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Jeroseline has been raising pigs for two years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Dovie

texts.en:
Dovie is 43 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Dovie is borrowing 12,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy fertilizers, pesticides and other farm supplies.

Dovie has been farming rice for 15 years and also earns additional income from selling dried fish.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Evaline

texts.en:
Evaline is 28 years old, married to Mr. Samwel, and blessed with three children aged between 10 and 7 years. She runs a grocery and cereals stall in the market. This has been her income generating business for the last five years, she gets an average monthly income of 10,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES).

She plans to use the amount borrowed of 26,000 KES to pay her children's school fees. Her dream is to provide her family with better living standards.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her kids.

loans.name: Joel

texts.es: Joel tiene de 31 años de edad, está casado con Jenny de 28 años quien es su esposa y madre de sus 02 hijos con quienes vive en su casa construida a base de adobe. Joel se dedica a la agricultura en un terreno de 3 hectáreas donde posee plantaciones de cacao, café, barbasco y  frutos de piña. Sus padres le enseñaron  este tradicional oficio porque  creció en este ambientey luego gracias a sus ahorros logro comprarse sus terrenos agrícolas. Tiene 9 años de experiencia y en cada campaña productiva comenta que es necesario contar con capital suficiente que le permita adquirir diversos requerimientos para sus terrenos tales como abono orgánico y herramientas para cultivo. Este es su cuarto préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En esta ocasión desea contar con 1,500 nuevos soles para la compra de semillas para ampliar sus sembríos de café, piña y barbasco debido al buen precio que tienen estos productos en su mercado local.
texts.en:
Joel is 31 years old and is married to 28-year-old Jenny, who is the mother of his two children. They live together in a house constructed from adobe. Joel makes a living from agriculture on a three-hectare plot where he plants cacao, coffee, barbasco and pineapple. His parents taught him this traditional work because he grew up in this environment. Thanks to his savings, he was then able to buy his own farmland.

He has nine years of experience and each productive season he notes that it is necessary to have sufficient capital to allow him to acquire a variety of things he needs for his land, such as organic fertilizer and tools for cultivation. This is his fourth loan with Kiva and he feels grateful for the financial support that he is receiving to get ahead. He also commits to making his payments in a punctual manner.

At this time he would like to have 1,500 Peruvian nuevos soles to buy seeds to expand his planting of coffee, pineapple and barbasco due to the good price that these products have in the local market.

loans.use: to buy seeds for coffee, pineapple and barbasco.

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
Gabriela es una joven artesana que vive con sus padres. Ella aún no tiene hijos pero espera tenerlos en el futuro. Su padre terminó el colegio y es técnico electricista pero su mamá solo pudo terminar el colegio, ellos son el principal motor para lograr sus metas.

Viven en Valle Hermoso en Cochabamba, una zona alejada del centro, muy humilde y con varias carencias en servicios básicos.

Desde muy joven efectuaba trabajos de artesanía, y es gracias a sus trabajos que se mantiene y ayuda en los gastos de su hogar. Su otro trabajo es como ayudante de una oficina legal donde gana un salario mínimo por no contar con el título de abogada.

Gabriela egresó de la carrera de Derecho, pero no pudo concluir sus estudios por falta de tiempo, ya que  tenía que trabajar en la tienda (como se ve en la foto) que con mucho esfuerzo y ahorro instaló en el centro de la ciudad para apoyar económicamente a su familia. Ahora busca un préstamo estudiantil para poder concluir su titulación en Licenciatura en Ciencias Jurídicas y Políticas, así alcanzar su sueño de ayudar a  mujeres y niños maltratados o que sufren violencia, para esto desea trabajar en el juzgado de familia.
texts.en:
Gabriela is a young artisan who lives with her parents. She does not have children but she hopes to have them in the future. Her father finished high school and studied to be an electrician but her mother was only able to finish high school and does not work. They are her main drive in achieving her goals.

They live in Valle Hermoso a neighborhood that is quite far from the center of Cochabamba. It is very humble and lacks many basic services. 

She has had artisan jobs since she was very young and thanks to the work she is able to take care of herself and help with the household expenses. Her other job is that of an aide in a legal office where she makes a small salary since she does not have a law degree. 

Gabriela left law school, but she was unable to complete her studies due to lack of time because she had to work at the store (as shown in the photo). She opened the store in the center of the city, after much effort and saving up, in order to help her family financially. Now, she is requesting a student loan to be able to finish her degree in Political Science and Law which will allow her to achieve her dream of helping women and children who are mistreated or are victims of violence. To do this she wants to work in family law.

loans.use: to pay for graduation expenses for her degree in Political Science and Law.

loans.name: Nyerere Group

texts.en:
Samson, who is in his early 20s, is a married man blessed with a baby boy. For seven years now, Samson has been managing his living by running two businesses: charcoal selling and a boda boda business. He works from 7am to 7pm daily and is able to make a very good return per month. 

This is Samson's 6th loan request from Kiva partner Tujijenge Tanzania, which will use to restock more sacks of charcoal. He used the previous loans to increase his charcoal capital by purchasing more sacks.  

Samson is a very hard working guy.  He has paid back all his previous loans successfully. With the profit received, he will cover home expenses and reinvest back into his business.  Samson has managed also to start building his house. He plans to finish building his house and then expand more his businesses. 

Samson will share this loan with his loan group" NYERERE GROUP" which consist 5 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: buy charcoal to resell

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 52 years old and married with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Delia has a buy and sell vegetables and fruits business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for one year.  Delia requested a PHP 13000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more vegetables and fruits to sell to her customers.

In the future, Delia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Ian Mae

texts.en:
Ian Mae is 33 years old and married with two children.

Ian Mae works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines.    She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from rice and gasoline retailing.

Ian Mae requested a PHP 4500 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items like snack foods, canned goods and other groceries to sell.   She has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan.  

Ian Mae aspires to save enough money to build a grocery store at public market.

loans.use: buy store inventory

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José Luis, tiene 27 años y es soltero, vive con sus padres y apoya en la economía familiar. Actualmente trabaja como técnico programador de CAD y soporte técnico en una empresa de asesoramiento en construcción. 
Hasta el momento Jose Luis, no pudo culminar la carrera de Ingeniería Civil por falta de recursos económicos y ahora ésta solicitando éste préstamo para lograr su titulación.

José Luis, quiere tener una empresa propia de construcción y ser su propio jefe.

Está muy agradecido a todas las personas que formar parte de KIVA por el apoyo que podrían brindarle para culminar sus estudios y se compromete a cumplir con su plan de pagos.
texts.en:
José Luis is 27 years old, single, lives with his parents, and helps with the family finances.  He currently works as a CAD programmer and technical support representative for a construction consulting company.  

As of this moment, José Luis is not able to finish his degree in Civil Engineering because he lacks financial resources.  Now he is requesting this loan so that he can obtain his degree.  José Luis wants to have his own construction company and be his own boss.  

He is very grateful to everyone who is affiliated with Kiva for their support since he will be able to finish his studies.  José Luis also promises to complete his payment plan.

loans.use: to obtain his degree in Civil Engineering.

loans.name: Jhonny Orlando

texts.es:
Jhonny, es soltero, tiene 31 años y vive con sus papás, trabaja hace muchos años en el área de la construcción, en la empresa de un amigo; por este motivo decidió estudiar Ingeniería Civil.  Inicio sus estudios el año 2010 y ahora le falta un año para obtener su título de Licenciatura en esta carrera, para lo cual ha solicitado éste préstamo. 

Proviene de una familia cuyos padres han logrado ser bachilleres, buscando de esta manera mejorar el nivel académico de su núcleo familiar.

Su sueño es tener su propia empresa constructora y ser un profesional destacado, sobresaliente y reconocido en el campo de la construcción, esto le permitirá diseñar y crear sus proyectos, así como contar con mejores ingresos. 

Está muy agradecido a todas las personas que forman parte de KIVA por la oportunidad que le brindan para culminar sus estudios y cuando él ya cuente con una solvencia económica quiere retribuir este apoyo en otras personas de bajos ingresos, por ello señala que: “Todos somos uno” y  “quién no arriesga no gana”.
texts.en:
Jhonny is 31 years old, single, and lives with his parents.  He has been working for many years in the field of construction at a company owned by a friend.  For this reason, he decided to study Civil Engineering.  Jhonny started his studies in 2010 and now he is one year away from obtaining his degree.  This is the reason why he is requesting a loan.  

Jhonny comes from a family in which his parents are high school graduates.  Therefore, he is looking for a way to raise the academic achievement level within his immediate family.  His dream is to have his own construction business and to become an outstanding, successful, and recognized professional in his field.  This would enable him to design and create his own projects, which would lead to a better income.  

Jhonny is extremely grateful to everyone affiliated with Kiva for the opportunity to finish his studies.  He is already financially solvent, so he wants to return the favor by helping other people who are of low income.  For this reason, his two mottos are “we are all one” and “no risk, no reward”.

loans.use: to obtain his degree in Civil Engineering.

loans.name: Inocensia

texts.en:
Inocensia works hard to support her family.  She is married and has a sewing business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 18 years now.

Inocensia requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase materials like threads, needles, fabric, etc. for her sewing business.  She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: buy sewing supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy farm inputs and pay for labour

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah, 34, is a salon owner. She is married to Michael, and together they are blessed with two children. 

Hannah has been running her salon for the past two years, with a monthly income of ksh 8,000, which she uses for her family upkeep and  to pay school fees for her children. 

Hannah is applying for her second loan with KADET after repaying the previous loan successfully. She will use the loan to buy beauty products, braids, weaves, etc. 

She will expand her business with the expected profit. 

Her hope and dream is to have a profitable business.

loans.use: To buy beauty products, braids, weaves, etc.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a abaca weaving business in the Philippines; she has been in this business for three years. Janet earns more income from buying and selling firewood.

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy additional raw materials for her abaca weaving business.

Janet has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional raw materials for her business.

loans.name: Elena Nelly

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita, pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

En este lugar vive la señora Elena, tiene 62 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene 7 hijos mayores de edad, tres de ellos viven con ella los mismos que junto a su esposo trabajan en el campo.

Doña Elena tiene una pequeña granja de pollos en su casa, compra por cajas los pollos cuando están pequeños los cría por tres meses y luego los vende en pie o por libras a los vecinos o entrega a las tiendas de la localidad, sus pollos se venden mucho ya que los cría con maíz por lo cual su carne es  parecida al pollo criollo. Trabaja todos los días dos a tres horas por día, es así como ellos salen adelante ya que su marido no gana mucho en sus faenas en el campo.
