Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar pollos, alimentos y medicinas  para que estos tengan un buen crecimiento y le dejen mejores ganancias. Es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos. 

Su sueño es seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The María Auxiliadora Communal Bank meets in Sequita parish, which belongs to Montecristi, a properous canton in the province of Manabí. It is full of hardworking people who are proud of their roots. Sequita is a parish whose residents are honest people who only know how to work and look after their families.

Elena lives here. She is 62 and is in a common-law marriage with 7 children, all adults. Three of them live with her and work with her husband in the fields.

Elena has a small chicken farm at her home. She buys the young chicks by the box, raises them for three months and then sells them live or by the pound to neighbours or delivers them to local shops. She sells a lot of chickens because she raises them on corn and so their meat is similar to creole chickens. She works for 2 or 3 hours every day and this is how they get by in life, as her husband does not earn much in his job in the fields.

Elena will use this loan to buy chickens, food and medicines so that they will grow well and give her better profits. She is a founding member of the communal bank and she likes it for the support it gives her with the loans. Her dream is to keep making progress in life.

loans.use: to buy chickens and feed and medicines for them.

loans.name: Katya Rosita

texts.es:
Katya es una joven de 19 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Pisco con sus padres y hermanos, ella es muy trabajadora, entusiasta,que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo se encuentra estudiando la carrera técnica de Administración de Empresas.
Por iniciativa propia, trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de productos de belleza y adicionalmente brinda atención en un grifo de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Katya se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindad comprara mayor cantidad y variedad de productos de belleza para abastecer su negocio, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ser una buena profesional.
texts.en:
Katya is a 19 year old woman who lives in the city of Pisco with her parents and siblings. She is very hard-working, enthusiastic and possesses a great desire to get ahead. Thanks to her own effort she is studying for a career in Business Administration. Through her initiative, she has a small business selling beauty product. In addition to this she works in a gas station in her city. She works ten hours daily and she feels that it is going well, due to her dedication and effort.

Katya is very grateful to the lenders at Kiva. Thanks to their help she can buy a larger quantity and variety of beauty products to stock her business. She can then continue working and struggling to achieve her dream, that of becoming a competent professional.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Hamed

texts.en:
Hamed is an 18-year-old married Syrian citizen, working and living in Lebanon. Hamed started working seven years ago, and he started his own business in 2009 to help his family. Hamed is responsible for the daily expenses of two of his family members. 

His business is going on just fine, but needs additional financial support to develop it in order to suit the market's needs. Thus, Hamed acquired a youth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy necessary updated tools for his business. He will also invest part of this loan in making necessary home repairs.

He hopes that in the future he will be able to have a larger work location and increase his employees from one at the present time to three or more.

loans.use: To buy necessary updated tools for his business

loans.name: 6 De Marzo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “6 DE MARZO”  iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Marcelina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido de awayos, venta de tucumanas, sastrería, venta de papitas, venta de juguetes, tienda de barrio, costura de pantalones.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Marcelina es integrante, ella indica que hace ocho meses que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de su cuñada que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de taller de costura; este negocio lo emprendió cuando se cazó, ya que su esposo  sabía técnicas de costura, deciden juntos establecer un taller de costura en su domicilio y contar con un negocio familiar.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tela) que adquirirá de las tiendas de la ciudad de El Alto, por mayor, y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará a pedido del cliente. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los créditos y los ahorros.
texts.en:
The “6 de Marzo” communal association will begin its fourth cycle at Pro Mujer, part of the Centro Focal de Collpani. The group has eight members and is directed by a board, of which Marcelina is the President. The members of the communal association have various kinds of business, including knitting traditional textiles, selling empanadas, tailoring, selling french fries, selling toys, a neighborhood store, and sewing pants.

The loan they are taking out will benefit small business owners such as Marcelina. She has been a member of Pro Mujer for eight months, having joined by invitation of her sister-in-law, who is a member of the institution. Marcelina currently has a sewing workshop business. She started this business when she got married, as her husband knew various sewing techniques and they decided to start a sewing workshop in their home in order to have a family business.
 
The loan she is taking out is to increase capital (buying fabric), which she will acquire wholesale in shops in the city of El Alto, and subsequently to make things to sell as requested by her customers. This kind of work allows her to generate resources to maintain her home as much as possible, as she is married and has five children.

When you ask her what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the loans and the savings.

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Diana Leonela

texts.es:
Diana es madre soltera, vive en la ciudad de Nazca con su pequeña hija y sus padres, ella es muy trabajadora, entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; gracias a su esfuerzo se encuentra estudiando la carrera profesional de Derecho.
Por iniciativa propia, Diana trabaja como representantes de ventas en una empresa comercial de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 8 horas y cree que le va bien su buen desempeño y dedicación.
Diana se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada cubrirá sus gastos de estudios, como pago de matricula y pensiones, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ser una profesional.
texts.en:
Diana is a single mother living in the city of Nazca with her young daughter and her parents. She is very hard-working and enthusiastic. Diana puts all her efforts into advancing her family. Thanks to her efforts, she is now studying for a career in Law.

On her own initiative, Diana works as a sales representative in a commercial enterprise in her city. She works every day for approximately 8 hours and believes things are going well due to her performance and dedication.

Diana is very grateful to Kiva lenders since thanks to the help they have offered, she can cover the costs of her studies, including paying all tuition and fees. Thus, she can continue working and advancing towards her grand dream of becoming a professional.

loans.use: to cover the educational costs of attending law school.

loans.name: Marta

texts.es:
Marta es una mujer de 46 años, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, en el distrito de Aguaytia, ella es madre madre soltera, muy trabajadora, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a sus 4 hijos, lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar desde muy joven, no pudo culminar sus estudios secundarios.
Por iniciativa propia, Marta trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de comida, adicionalmente cría y vende aves de corral, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Marta se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprará mesas y utensilios para su negocio, adicionalmente comprara alimento balanceado para sus aves, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Marta is a 46 year old woman who lives in  Pucallpa, in Aguaytia District. She is a hard-working single mother who puts all her effort into getting her four children ahead. Unfortunately due to a lack of resources since she was young, she could not complete her Secondary School studies. Through her own initiative Marta works in her small business selling food. She also raises and sells poultry. She works about ten hours a day and feels that it is going well for her, thanks to her effort and dedication. 

Marta is very grateful to The Kiva lenders. Thanks to them she can buy tables and utensils for her business. Also she will buy balanced feed for her poultry. She can continue working and striving to achieve her dream, which is to have her own home.

loans.use: to buy tables and cooking utensils.

loans.name: Lenebeth

texts.en:
Lenebeth is 47 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Lenebeth is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizer, pesticides, and other farm supplies.

Lenebeth has been farming rice for five years, and also earns additional income from selling frozen foods.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to buy more farm land.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides, and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Dayanara Maita

texts.en: Dayanara Maita is 19 years old, married, and has one child. She works hard to provide for her family. Dayanara Maita runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from selling rice. Dayanara Maita aspires to save enough money to build a grocery store at the public market.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rubina's Group

texts.en:
Rubina is 47, and she is married, living with her husband and four children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her financial condition is neither good nor bad; her husband and sons earn enough to contribute to the household expenses. 

Her husband is a furniture maker and makes very fine furniture such as wooden beds, chairs, tables, cots etc. He has been doing this work for 30 years and has lots of experience. Both her sons are doing separate jobs, but their income is less than their father’s. 

Her husband became sick, and most of their savings was spent on medical treatment. Now he is hale and hearty, but does not have the resources to buy raw materials for making furniture. Therefore, Rubina requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so her husband would be able to buy raw material such as wooden planks, nails, glue, chipboard, etc.. to continue his business. 

Rubina says thanks to Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, and is feeling happy after this loan. 

Note: Rubina raises her hand in the given picture to represent herself.

loans.use: To buy raw material such as wooden planks, nails, chipboard, etc...  for making furniture.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
This is Mercy, 48, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Edgardo and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Mercy operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy a small amount of shampoo or cooking oil, or an egg. She earns a profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

She is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan to help her continue operating her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Mercy dreams to expand her business and hopes to have a good life. She meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To buy grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.en:
Yusuf is a permanent resident of rural Sanga in the Kiruhura district; he is married, with seven children and two dependants from his late sister. He grew up with only his mother, as his father died when he was young. 

Because of the need to survive and to support his mother, he started banana farming on a small scale on the land he got from his grandfather. This banana plantation was used as a source of food for the family, and income for their survival. This business has grown, giving him an opportunity to start a small nursery school in a nearby trading centre to support his family and to fill the need for education in his community. 

He has managed to construct a three room classroom, which he has failed to complete and that is why he is requesting a loan of UGX 5,000,000 to complete the classrooms.

In the photo is Yusuf with his wife.

loans.use: To buy building materials to complete a small nursery school.

loans.name: Anicia

texts.en:
Anicia is 53 years old, widowed, and has nine children. Anicia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her store.

Anicia has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from selling purified drinking water and gasoline. Anicia aspires to save enough money to build a grocery store at the public market.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Sol Naciente Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SOL NACIENTE”  iniciará el décimo segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Zulma es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de barrio, venta de pollos a la broster, venta de perfumes, producción de lácteos, licorería, venta de cubrecamas, consultorio dental.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Zulma es integrante, ella indica que hace seis años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de su amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de licorería; este negocio lo emprendió de un inquilino anterior que tuvo en su casa, que realizaba el mismo negocio, cuando este se fue decide seguir con el mismo negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de licores) que adquirirá de las agencias mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en créditos y salud.
texts.en:
The “Sol Naciente” (Rising Sun) communal bank will start the 12th cyle in Pro Mujer as part of the Collpani Focal Center.  It has 8 members led by a governing board presided over by Zulma.  The communal bank members carry out a variety of businesses among which are: neighborhood store, Broaster-style chicken sales, perfume sales, dairy products production, liquor store, bedspread sales and dental office.

The loan they’ll take out will benefit small micro businesswomen like Zulma. She states that she’s been part of Pro Mujer for six years having joined thanks to an invitation from a friend who is a member of the institution.  At present, she has a liquor store.  She learned the business from a former tenant she had at home who was in the same business. When he left, she decided to continue with the same business.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase capital.  She’ll buy liquor from wholesalers in the city of El Alto and then sell it in her sales space.  This way of working makes it possible for her to generate income to support her home as possible for she’s single and has two children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers the credit training and the health.

loans.use: to buy liquor.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 27-year-old married man, who has been working in motorcycle repairs for eleven years to make his living.

In 2008, he started his own business to improve his living and increase his income. It was an impressive step forward, and that's why he is working hard to improve it.

Today, Ibrahim is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy necessary spare parts for his business and register his business car.

He hopes that he can stay capable of developing his business and increasing his income.

loans.use: To buy necessary spare parts for his business, and to register his business car

loans.name: Merida

texts.en:
Merida is a 45-year-old married woman with four children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. Her main business is a retail shop for second-hand clothes, but she also practices farming to earn additional income. She has hardships of stiff competition and bad weather, while her vision is to own a wholesale shop and buy land to expand her farming activities.

Merida intends to use the loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Virginia es una mujer de 29 años, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con su pequeño hijo, ella es madres soltera, trabajadora, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, Virginia trabaja en el área de almacén de una empresa comercial de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Virginia se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada mejorara su vivienda, ella desea comprar materiales de construcción para reforzar su vivienda, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ver a su hijo convertido en un buen profesional.
texts.en:
Virginia is a 29-year-old woman who lives in the city of Pucallpa with her young son. She is a hard-working single mother who dedicates all of her efforts to getting her family ahead. Of her own initiative, Virginia works in the warehouse area of a store in her city. She works every day for approximately ten hours, and believes that her job is going well thanks to her dedication and effort.

Virginia is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, as thanks to the help provided she will be able to improve her home. She wants to buy construction materials to her make her home more secure. In this way she will be able to keep working and making an effort to achieve her greatest dream, which is that her son have a good professional career.

loans.use: to improve her home

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en:
Innocent is a 36-year-old married man with three children living in Masindi, Uganda. He is a civil servant working with the Ministry of Health, but also operates a drug shop to supplement his meager salary, which is even not paid on time by the government.

The high cost of rent and license fees affect his business growth, while his dream is to own a pharmacy. 

Innocent intends to use the loan to buy drugs to sell.

loans.use: to buy drugs to sell in his drug shop.

loans.name: Melisa

texts.en:
This is Melisa, 27, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. Her partner is August, an employee. She and August manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Melisa operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings where all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to use cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings, and frozen foods. 

Melisa dreams to expand her business and hopes to have a good life. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken, vegetables and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Can

texts.en: Can is requesting a new loan to buy new gym equipment to better satisfy her customers. Can's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business and attract new customers. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase better quality gym equipment.

loans.name: Edwin Jesus

texts.es:
Edwin es un hombre de 22 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Ica con sus padres y hermanos, el es muy trabajador, entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Edwin no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Edwin trabaja como vigilante y adicionalmente los fines de semana maneja su taxi brindando servicios de transporte en su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 12 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Edwin se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada cubrirá los gastos de mantenimiento y reparación de su vehículo, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose con el deseo de lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Edwin, 22, is single living with his parents and siblings in the city of Ica.  He’s very hardworking and enthusiastic and very much wants to improve.  Sadly, for lack of economic resources and because he needed to start working, Edwin was unable to study a professional career.

On his own initiative, Edwin works as a security guard and also on weekends as a taxi driver providing transportation services in his city.  He works every day for about 12 hours and believes he does well because of his dedication and effort.

Edwin’s very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support provided he will be able to cover the cost to service and repair his vehicle thus being able to continue working and striving to reach is great dream of having a house of his own.

loans.use: to pay to service and repair his taxi.

loans.name: Yeisson Javier

texts.es:
Yeisson es un hombre de 21 años, es soltero vive en la ciudad de Ica con sus padres y hermanos, el es muy trabajador, entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Yeisson no ha podido estudiar la carrera profesional de de Ingeniería Mecánica.
Por iniciativa propia, Yeisson trabaja como obrero de campo en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Yeisson se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada cubrirá los gastos de reparación de las tuberías y servicios higiénicos de su vivienda, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de estudiar una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Yeisson, 21, is single and lives in Ica with his parents and siblings. He works hard and enthusiastically to get ahead. Sadly Yeisson lacked the money to study mechanical engineering and had to work instead. Yeisson decided to become a field worker for a municipal agriculture project. He works about 10 hours a day and thinks things are going well due to his dedication and efforts.

Yeisson thanks the Kiva lenders, whose funding will allow him to repair pipes and toilets in his house. He will continue working hard to achieve his dream of studying for a professional career.

loans.use: to repair pipes and toilets in his house.

loans.name: Mable

texts.en: Mable is 40 years old with 12 dependent children, all in school. She married to a man who does not offer any support to the family. She operates a banana farm that produces over 50 bunches of bananas in a month. This business enables her to pay tuition for her children and take care of all the other needs of the whole family. The banana plantation has also enabled her to construct a semi-permanent house for her family. She is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 UGX to add organic manure into her plantation and also to compete her house under construction. In the photo is Mable with her husband.

loans.use: To buy organic manure and complete the family residential house

loans.name: Melsa

texts.en:
Melsa, 35, is a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Noel, a driver, and a mother to their children. She, together with her husband, manage their household while operating the business. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

Melsa maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics, and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and others. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalog, and these are the profits that dealers are investing in as their income. 

Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 2,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise such as shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments, and other products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands it.  

Melsa dreams to be successful in her business and hopes to help her family financially. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional merchandise such as clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Abbass

texts.en:
Abbass is a 28-year-old married father of two children who has been working as a baker for 11 years.
In 2003, he opened his own bakery to improve his living. His bakery is well known in his region, but he still needs to increase his business capital. 
He is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to buy necessary raw materials for his business such as flour, sugar and yeast. In this way, Abbass will be capable of increasing his production and selling, which will improve his family's socioeconomic situation.
His dream is to provide his children with the best standard of living and he will work hard to provide them the best education possible. He only had the chance to acquire his intermediate studies.
He is meeting almost all of the home delivery requests, but he is planning to start supplying schools which will  increase his income and will require extra employees.

loans.use: To buy necessary raw materials for his business such as flour, sugar and yeast

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a taxi.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 40 years old and married with seven children.

Rowena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries like soap, snack foods, sardines and spices.

Rowena has borrowed and repaid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from furniture making.

Rowena aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries like soap, snack foods, sardines and spices.

loans.name: Dao

texts.en: Dao would like to take another loan to buy a greater quantity of green beans to make bean sprouts for selling. Dao's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers, and increasing sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of green beans to make bean sprouts

loans.name: Sabas

texts.en:
Sabas has managed his transportation service business for twelve years. His riders carry passengers to and from the town to their destination nearby. He  successfully repaid his previous loan from GDMPC that he used for vehicle spare parts and accessories. 

Recently, he borrowed a new loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase tires and spare parts. He plans to buy a four-wheel vehicle in the future.

loans.use: to purchase tires and spare parts.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
This is Jonathan. He previously accessed a 50,000 PHP loan that he used to buy feeds and additional hogs needed in his business. His earnings were a big help in their personal, house hold and business expenditures.

He would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan for him to buy feeds and additional hogs needed in his business. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain his daily needs. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Jonathan hopes that his business will continue to expand and dreams of having his own family. He meets every week with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work. It is where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for feeds and additional hogs needed in his business.

loans.name: Ricardo Cesar

texts.es:
Ricardo es un hombre de 33 años, vive en la ciudad de Chiclayo, en el distrito de Guadalupe con su esposa y sus tres hijos, el es  muy trabajador, entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia;lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajara, Ricardo no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Ricardo trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de menestras y tubérculos, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Ricardo se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada mejorara su vivienda, ya que desea comprar materiales de construcción para avanzar una habitación y reforzar su hogar, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ver a sus hijos convertidos en buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Ricardo, 33, lives in the city of Chiclayo, Guadalupe District, with his wife and three children.  He’s very hardworking and enthusiastic and focuses all his efforts into moving his family forward.  Sadly, for lack of economic resources and because he needed to work, Ricardo was unable to study a professional career.

On his own initiative, Ricardo works in a small business selling vegetables and tubers.  He works every day for about 10 hours and believes he does well thanks to his dedication and effort.

Ricardo is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support provided he will be able to do some home improvements.  He wants to buy building supplies to add a room and to reinforce his home.  He will thus continue working and striving to reach his great dream of seeing his children become good professionals.

loans.use: to do some home repairs.

loans.name: Priscilla Judith

texts.es:
Priscilla es una mujer de 21 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con sus padres y hermanos, ella es muy trabajadora, entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar,Priscilla no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Priscilla trabaja vendiendo ropa, calzado y brinda servicios de costura y compostura de ropa, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Priscilla se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva,ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprara una maquina de coser industrial para acondicionar su negocio, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su taller de confecciones.
texts.en:
Priscilla, 21, is single and lives in Pucallpa with her parents and siblings. She works hard, is enthusiastic, and wants to succeed. Unfortunately, Priscilla needed to work and did not have funds to study for a professional career. Priscilla decided to start selling clothing and footwear and offer dressmaking and alteration services. She works about 10 hours each day and believes things are going well due to her dedication and efforts.

Priscilla thanks the Kiva lenders, whose funding will allow her to buy an industrial sewing machine for her business. She will keep working and striving to achieve her great dream of having a dressmaking shop.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Dora Luz

texts.es:
Dora es una mujer de 40 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, ella es muy trabajadora, entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Dora no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Dora trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de comida, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y buena sazón.
Dora se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprará insumos y materiales de cocina para acondicionar su negocio, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su vivienda en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Dora, 40, is single and lives in Pucallpa. She works hard and enthusiastically to get ahead. Sadly, Dora lacked the funds to study for a professional career and needed to work instead. Dora decided to open a small food business. She works about 10 hours each day and thinks things are going well due to her dedication and cooking skills.

Dora thanks the Kiva lenders, whose funding will allow her to buy cooking supplies and ingredients for her business. She will continue to work and strive to achieve her great dream of living in a better house.

loans.use: to buy cooking supplies and ingredients.

loans.name: Ha

texts.en:
Ha, 55, is married and has three children. She lives with her husband in Ho Chi Minh City. They have been running a business of thread weaving for thirty years. Ha is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying more raw materials to increase her production and sales.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and generates a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions and sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials to increase her production of thread in her thread weaving business.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa is requesting a new loan to buy a greater variety of flowers to sell in her store. Hoa's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. 

She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety of flowers to sell in her store.

loans.name: Choulin

texts.en:
Choulin is 48 years old, a married mother of seven children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Choulin has a fishing business in the Philippines. Choulin requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Choulin has been in this business for nine years.  In the future, Choulin would like to save enough money to build a variety store at public market.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Chinh

texts.en:
Chinh is 43 years old, and is married. She and her husband have been running a business making and selling shoes. They started this business 25 years ago. They live in Ho Chi Minh City.

Chinh is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying leather materials to increase her production of shoes. With that she will be able to increase the turnover of her business. 

She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities, and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy leather materials to increase her production of shoes.

loans.name: Van

texts.en:
Van is a 45-year-old married woman. She lives with her two children and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband earn money through working as tailors. They serve people in their community. They started this business eighteen years ago.

Van would like a loan to purchase a larger quantity of thread and sewing materials. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: To purchase a larger quantity of threads and sewing materials.

loans.name: Yen

texts.en:
Yen is a 39-year-old married woman. She lives with her two children and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns money by working as a painter.  Yen supports her family by running a sewing business that serves people in her community. She started this business twenty-three years ago.

Yen would like a loan to purchase a larger quantity of threads and sewing materials. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase a larger quantity of threads and sewing materials.

loans.name: Lazia

texts.en:
Lazia is married with five children who all go to school. She has no additional family members. She sells green bananas at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for five years. She works seven days a week. She gets additional income from selling fried cassava and chapatti at the market. 

She has applied for a loan of Uganda shillings 100,000 from MCDTSACCO to buy bunches of green bananas. Her major business challenges include seasonality (rainy season) which hinders her movements and transportation. She is aspiring to educate her children to university level. She resides in rented house and the family has access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expense includes school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Mariela Annabelle

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita, pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

En este lugar vive la señora Mariela, tiene 22 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 3 años y el menor de apenas un mes de nacido. El  esposo trabaja en Manta en una fábrica. 

Doña Mariela para ayudar con los gastos del hogar se  dedica a la cría de chanchos y pollos, ella compra estos animalitos cuando aun están pequeños y  luego los tiene por espacio de tres a cuatro meses hasta que tengan un peso adecuado para después venderlos a comerciantes que llegan hasta su casa los mismos que los trasladan hasta los centros de faenamiento o a los distintos mercados de la ciudad y comercializar la carne en estos lugares.  Esta actividad la realiza en sus momentos desocupados así ella se gana algo sin salir de su casa.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar alimentos y medicinas para pollos y chanchos. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 4 ciclos y  le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos.  

Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The “María Auxiliadora” communal bank meets in La Sequita Parish that belongs to Montecristi, a prosperous canton in Manabí that’s full of hardworking, dedicated people who are proud of their roots.  La Sequita is a parish of honest people who just work and are dedicated to their families.

Mariela, 22, lives here.  She’s married and has two children, a three-year-old and a newborn that’s barely a month old.  Her husband is a factory worker in Mata.

To help with household expenses, Mariela works raising pigs and chickens.  She buys these animals when they are still small and raises them for a period of three to four months until they reach an adequate weight to then sell them to merchants who come by her house and subsequently take them to butchering centers or to various markets in the city to sell their meat there.  She does these activities in her free time earning income this way without having to leave home.

The will use this loan to buy feed and medicine for chickens and pigs.  She’s been in the communal bank for four cycles and she likes it because of the help the credits provide.  Her dream is to provide the best for her children.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicine for chickens and pigs.

loans.name: Katherine Maryuri Vanessa

texts.es:
Katherine es una mujer de 27 años, vive en la ciudad de Huaraz, en el distrito de Carhuaz con su pequeña hija, ella es madre soltera, trabajadora, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar.
Por iniciativa propia, Katherine trabaja en su pequeña tienda de abarrotes, bebidas, adicionalmente en las noches vende frituras como pollo broaster y frituras, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y buena sazón.
Katherine se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprara mayor cantidad y variedad de abarrotes para su negocio, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ver a su hija convertida en una gran profesional.
texts.en:
Katherine, 27, lives in Huaraz in the Carhuaz district with her young daughter. She is a hardworking, single mother, who dedicates all her efforts to supporting her family. Sadly, she lacked money to study and had to start working instead. Katherine decided to open a small store, where she sells groceries and beverages. At night, she also sells fried foods like chicken. She works about 10 hours every day and feels things are going well due to her dedication and cooking skills.

Katherine thanks the Kiva lenders, whose funding will allow her to buy larger quantities and more variety of groceries for her business. She will keep working and striving to achieve her great dream of seeing her daughter become a professional.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
This is Lolita. Her previous loan was a big help in her business as she was able to buy the raw ingredients needed on her food stall. Her income from the loan assisted her everyday expenditures at home. She has had this business for three years now. She is continuously working to provide for her everyday needs.
 
She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan for her to purchase raw ingredients and supplies needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Lolita dreams of expanding her business and hopes to be successful in life. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken and vegetables needed in her business.

loans.name: Lauriana

texts.en:
Lauriana is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Lauriana is 50 years old and has two children who are in school.

Lauriana has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. Lauriana requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional raw materials like abaca fiber, etc. for her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Lauriana has been in this business for 13 years. In the future, Lauriana would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional raw materials like abaca fiber for her business.

loans.name: Hai

texts.en:
Hai, 49, is married and has one son. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband run a business selling chicken. 

Hai is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a cold-storage unit to keep the chicken in a good condition and provide a better quality product to her customers. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a cold-storage unit to keep chicken in a good condition.

loans.name: Hiep

texts.en:
Hiep is 56 years old and is widowed with three children. She has been running a business selling coconuts for five years. She started this business to cover her expenses and to generate income to raise her children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Hiep is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater quantity of coconuts for sale and hopes that this will enable her to attract more customers. She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities, and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy a greater quantity of coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Fati

texts.fr:
Madame  Fati est âgée de 57 ans,  mariée  et   mère de 5 enfants, elle vit dans une famille nucléaire  au quartier Bagadadji  (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas fréquenté  l’école pour des raisons sociales, elle commença très tôt à faire le petit commerce auprès de sa mère qui vendait des poissons. Après plusieurs années d’apprentissage à côté de cette dernière, elle finit seule à  mener plusieurs activités : vente de céréales, de moutons et exploitation d’un moulin. 
Dans  le but d’avoir un équipement flamboyant neuf  afin de faire face à la demande clientèle, elle a fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est en relation avec cette dernière depuis 48 mois,  après 2 prêts solidaires et 2 prêts individuels bien remboursés. Elle est à son 3ème prêt individuel qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter  un moulin. Elle s’approvisionne sur place. 
Madame Fati vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 22.500 FCFA, qui lui sert à rembourser son prêt et à aider son mari dans la prise en charge des dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
Ms. Fati is 57 years old, married, and the mother of five.
She lives in a nuclear family in the Bagadadji district (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Not having attended school due to societal reasons, she soon started to work in small-scale commerce along side her mother, who used to sell fish. After several years of apprenticeship at her side, she is finally working by herself running several businesses: selling grains and sheep and making use of a grinder (mill). 

With the goal of acquiring new, shiny equipment to cope with customer demands, she turned toward the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. She has had an association with the institution for the last 48 months. After two solidarity loans and two individual loans, which she repaid, she is now on her third individual loan, which she intends to use to purchase a grinder. She gets her supplies locally. 

Ms. Fati accepts cash or credit from her customer base, composed mostly of women. She plans on making a monthly profit of 22,500 francs CFA that will be used to pay back the loan and to help her husband to cover family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase a grinder

loans.name: Marchie

texts.en: Marchie manages her own farm of rice while, at the same time, works in a private company to earn a living. She resides in her new house located in Lapasan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She had successfully repaid her previous loan that was used for farm inputs. Recently, she borrowed a new loan of 50,000 PHP to cover the costs of farm maintenance and fertilization. She is hopeful to gain a higher profit this season to use it for her house's improvement.

loans.use: to cover the costs of farm maintenance and fertilization

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Joel works hard to support his family.

Joel has a tricycle transportation business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from a general store and raising ducks. Joel is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF in order to buy spare parts for his tricycle.

Joel has been sustaining his business activities through his past 15 loans from NWTF. Joel hopes that his hard work will help him attain his dream: to save enough money so he can afford to send his children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his tricycle.

loans.name: Fatoumata Sékou

texts.fr:
Madame Fatoumata Sékou est âgée de 60 ans,  veuve  et  grand mère de plusieurs enfants, elle vit dans une famille nucléaire  au quartier Sokalakono  de Ségou  (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elle n’a pas fréquenté l’école pour des raisons sociales car ses parents    conservateurs des années de la colonisation  voyaient en la scolarisation d’une fille, une porte de déperdition sociale. Elle commença alors très tôt à faire le petit commerce auprès de sa mère qui vendait des poissons. Après plusieurs années d’apprentissage à côté de cette dernière, elle finit par opter mener les activités d’achat et de vente de céréales notamment le riz. 
Dans  le but d’avoir d’augmenter son fonds de commerce  afin de faire face à la demande clientèle, elle a fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est en relation avec cette dernière depuis 24 mois,  après  2 prêts individuels bien remboursés. Elle est à son 3ème prêt individuel qu’elle utilisera pour acheter  2 tonnes de riz   . Elle s’approvisionne sur place et à Niono. 
Madame Fatoumata  vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle mixte citadine. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 30.000 FCFA, qui lui sert à rembourser son prêt et de se prendre en charge ainsi que ses petits enfants.
texts.en:
Ms. Fatoumata Sékou is 60 years old, a widow, and the grandmother of several children. She lives in a nuclear family in the Sokalakono district of Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). She did not attend school because of her parents, conservative from years of colonization, who saw that educating girls was wasteful in life. So she started early on to work in small-scale commerce along side her mother, who used to sell fish. After several years of apprenticeship at her side, she finally opted to run a business buying and selling grains, especially rice.

With the goal of increasing her business capital to cope with customer demands, she turned toward the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. She has had an association with the institution for the last 24 months. After two individual loans, which she repaid, she is now on her third individual loan, which she will use to purchase 2 tonnes of rice. She gets her supplies locally and in Niono. 

Ms. Fatoumata accepts cash or credit from her mixed customers base of city folks. She plans on making a monthly profit of 30,000 francs CFA that will be used to pay back the loan and to support herself, as well as her grandchildren.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 28-year-old married man, who has been working in the chicken business for the last ten years. In 2007, he decided to start his own business to increase his income and improve his living.

His sells fresh chicken, but he is planning to expand his working zone. That's why he is applying for a YOUTH loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmou to buy a  new display refrigerator and a special gas grill for chicken (roasting-jack). He wants to start selling grilled chicken and prepared sandwiches in order to open his small, special chicken sandwiches snack store soon.

He dreams of having his own restaurant in the future and he believes that this is his first step toward making this dream come true.

loans.use: to buy a display refrigerator and a special gas grill for chicken (roasting-jack)

loans.name: Katerina

texts.ru: Катерине 21 год. Она учится на фармацевта на 4 курсе колледжа. Учится дистанционно, так как работает фармацевтом на частичной занятости. Катерина живет вместе с мамой, которая поддерживает ее в учебе. Она просит предоставить ей кредит в размере 5,000 гривен для оплаты зимнего семестра в колледже.
texts.en: Katerina is 21 years old. She is a distance learning pharmacy student in her fourth year. She is working part-time as a pharmacist. Katerina lives with her mother, who is supporting her while she goes to school. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 hryvnia to pay for the winter semester of college.

loans.use: pay her college tuition

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 57 years old and is married with seven children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Letecia is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her pigs.

Letecia has been raising pigs for 20 years and also earns additional income from selling vegetables. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en:
Johnson is a permanent resident of a village in Rugando in Mbarara district. He is married with eight children and four dependents from his brother who died of AIDS five years ago. 

He grew up with only a mother as his father was not known to him, and the mother made his life difficult. Being pushed by the need to survive and support his mother, he started banana farming on a small scale on the land he got from his grandmother. This banana plantation was used as a source of food for the family and income for their survival. 

Johnson is a hardworking man who managed to start other businesses like poultry. These businesses have grown, giving him an opportunity to support his family and dependents, and construct a house for his family. 

He is requesting for a loan of UGX 4,000,000 to complete his house and adequately accommodate the dependents. In the picture is Johnson with his brother(left to right) who also signed the waiver form.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to complete building his house and adequately accommodate his dependents.

loans.name: Amirkhon

texts.ru: Амирхону всего 29 лет. Он один обеспечивает большую семью. У него пожилые родители, жена домохозяйка и маленькие дети. У Амирхона высшее образование, но по специальности он не нашел работу и некоторое время работал в будке по ремонту часов. Амирхон хочет купить технику по чистке и переработке хлопка. Они надеются, что вместе с другом справятся с таким видом деятельности. Когда он купит подходящую технику, он сможет начать свой бизнес и уличшить свои жизненные условия. Для Амирхона очень важна это работа. Ведь в районе Хамадони основной вид деятельности только животноводство. Он не хочет упустить свой шанс и серьезно взяться за это дело. Желаем Амирхону успехов.
texts.en: Amirkhon is only 29 years old. He supports a large family including his elderly parents, his wife (who is a housewife), and his young children. Amirkhon has a higher education, but he has not been able to find a job in his field. For a time, he worked repairing clocks. Amirkhon wants to buy equipment for cleaning and processing cotton. He is hoping that, along with his friend, he can successfully make a business of this.  They hope that, together with a friend cope with this kind of activity. When he buys this equipment, he will be able to start a business and improve their standard of living. This work is very important to Amirkhon. In Hamadoni, just about the only way to make a living is by raising livestock. He does not want to miss his chance to seize this opportunity. We wish Amirkhon success.

loans.use: purchase of equipment for cleaning and processing cotton

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan tiene 35 años, está casado con Vilma quien es madre de sus 3 hijos que viven con él en su casa hecha con bloques de adobe. Hace más de 10 años se dedica a la agricultura en sus terrenos de 3 hectáreas, el cual logro adquirir con ayuda de sus padres y el dinero que ahorró desempeñándose de manera independiente.
Tiene el orgullo de haber sacado adelante a su familia con la venta de sus productos como son el cacao orgánico, barbasco; entre otros. Cuenta con el firme apoyo de su esposa quien lo acompaña desde muy temprano en sus labores cotidianas que consisten en brindarle un adecuado mantenimiento a sus plantaciones.
En  más de una ocasión contrata a trabajadores del lugar para tareas complicadas tales como el retiro de maleza y recolección de los frutos maduros que posteriormente vende a los comprandores zonales quienes lo conocen por obtener una buena producción. Se siente muy contento por la manera en como desempeña su labor porque tiene las condiciones del caso en cuanto a la calidad de suelo y obtención del abono orgánico.
Uno de sus principales objetivos es adquirir un terreno adicional e iniciarse en la producción de café, así como el cultivo de otros árboles frutales. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En esta oportunidad desea contar con 1,500 nuevos soles para comprar abono orgánico y contratar trabajadores del lugar.
texts.en:
Juan, 35, is married to Vilma who is the mother of their three children; they all live with him in an adobe house.  He’s worked in agriculture for the last 10 years growing on his 3-hectare parcel of land that he managed to acquire with his parents’ help and with money he saved working independently.

He’s proud to have moved his family forward with the sale of his products like organic cocoa beans and barbasco [an evergreen bush], among others.  His wife is his main support and she goes with him every day starting very early to help him with his daily chores consisting in providing adequate care to his crops.

On more than one occasion he hires local workers to help with the more complicated tasks like weeding and picking the ripe fruit that he then sells to regional buyers who know him because of his good production.  He feels very happy with the way he does his work because he has good soil and is able to get organic manure.

One of his main objectives is to buy additional land to start growing coffee as well as fruit trees.  This is his first Kiva loan and he feels grateful for the financial support he gets to continue forward.  Also, he commits to make his installment payments punctually.  On this occasion he needs 1,500 new soles to buy organic manure and to hire local workers.

loans.use: to buy organic manure and to hire local workers.

loans.name: And Siggil Hann 13 Group

texts.fr: L’Association And Siggil Hann regroupe plusieurs femmes ressortissant de l’une des banlieues  Dakaroises. Au départ elles se fréquentaient   a travers des  tontines  hebdomadaires  qui leur permettaient de s’autofinancer pour soutenir leurs activités génératrices de revenus .Actuellement l’association vient de signer un partenariat avec l’UIMCEC dans le cadre du renforcement du pouvoir économique des femmes  pour les aider  a mieux gérer leurs activités et lutter contre la pauvreté. De ce fait And Siggil Hann 13  est un groupe de crédit de 14 membres  qui habitent la  même localité  et évoluent  dans le même secteur d’activité. Elles sont représentées par madame Diatou, femme mariée qui  pratique la vente de tissus et de chaussures depuis 4 ans .Parallèlement  aussi elle  évolue dans la vente de poissons fumés. Elle est membre de l’un des guichets de l’UIMCEC et sollicite un crédit prévu pour l’achat de tissus, chaussures et poissons fumés  a revendre. Elle ambitionne de développer son activité de commerce pour accroitre ses bénéfices  pour épargner et parvenir a diversifier les  produits qu’elle commercialise. Son  projet dans le futur consiste à acquérir son propre magasin de  vente de tissus.
texts.en:
The association "And Siggil Hann" comprises several women citizens from a suburb of Dakar. At first, they used to associate with one another through weekly tontine meetings enabling them to finance themselves to support their revenue-generating businesses. Today, the association just signed a partnership with the microfinance institution U-IMCEC to bolster the women's economic power in order to help them manage their businesses better and to fight poverty.

To this end, "And Siggil Hann 13" is a group of fourteen members who live in the same town and who work in the same business sector. They are represented by Ms. Diatou, a married woman who has been selling cloth and shoes for four years. She is a member of a U-IMCEC branch and is requesting a loan for purchasing some cloth, shoes, and smoked fish to resell. Her ambition is to develop her business and to increase her profits in order to save money and to diversify successfully the products she sells. Her future plans include acquiring her own store for selling cloth.

loans.use: to purchase cloth, shoes, and smoked fish to resell

loans.name: Sanita

texts.en:
Sanita manages a mini grocery store, which is located in front of her house.Her husband is a farmer as well as, at the same time, a manufacturer of hallows blocks. Sanita started her business with minimal capital and strong determination  which makes her proud and grateful.

Sanita has three children. Profits she gained were used to educate two of her children. Sanita’s goal is to keep her business profitable and supply all of her costumers' demands. She decided to ask for a loan of 30,000 PHP to increase the stock of merchandise she offers. This loan will allow her to buy breads, seasoning, coffee, sugar, and cooking oil. She knows that this loan amount has a lot to do with her business growth. She just hope that lenders will continue to provide her financial assistance so she can let her youngest child finish her studies.

loans.use: to buy breads, seasoning, coffee, sugar, and cooking oil for her variety store

loans.name: Victoria Ana

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita, pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

En este lugar vive la señora Victoria, tiene 47 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen una  hija mayor de edad e independiente. Su esposo se dedica a la albañilería.
 
Doña Victoria trabaja en una guardería en la localidad, pero además de eso también se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  lugar de trabajo,  ella en su casa también se dedica a la cría de pollos y chanchos con lo cual le queda algo extra cuando vende estos animalitos, la roa la deja a crédito a sus clientes y cobra cada ocho días. Su mercadería la va a comprar a Portoviejo o a  Guayaquil. Tiene más de 10  años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar ropa y alimento para chanchos. Está en el Banco Comunal casi desde sus inicios y  le gusta porque con uno de los créditos empezó su negocio. 

Su sueño es seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The communal bank María Auxiliadora is in the parish of Sequita. It is in Montecristi, a prosperous canton in the province of Manabí, which is full of hardworking and dedicated people who are proud of their roots. The inhabitants of the parish of Sequita are honest people who only ever work and dedicate themselves to their families.

Victoria, who is 47 years old and married, lives in this parish. From her marriage, she has one daughter who is over the age of majority and independent. Victoria's husband works in masonry.

Victoria works in a daycare in the area, but on top of that she also works selling all different types of clothes. She sells door to door and she also makes sales at her place of work. She gives her customers the clothes on credit and collects payments every eight days. She buys her merchandise in Portoviejo or Guayaquil. She has been working at this activity for than ten years, and it is going very well for her.

At home, she also works raising chickens and pigs, which gives her some extra income when she sells the animals off. 
 
She will use this loan to buy clothes, as well as to purchase feed for her pigs. She has been with this communal bank since it opened, and she likes it because she started her business with a loan from them.

Her dream is to continue moving forward.

loans.use: to buy clothes, as well as feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Leonilda Ines

texts.es:
Leonilda es una mujer de 34 años, vive con su esposo en la ciudad de Ica, ella es muy trabajadora, entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar Leonilda no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Leonilda trabaja como empleada del hogar en diversas viviendas de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Leonilda se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprará materiales de construcción para mejorar su vivienda, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener un negocio comercial.
texts.en:
Leonilda, 34, lives with her husband in the city of Ica.  She’s very hardworking and enthusiastic and focuses all her efforts into moving her family forward.  Sadly, due to the lack of economic resources and the need to work, Leonilda was unable to study a professional career.

On her own initiative, Leonilda works as a domestic employee in various houses in her city.  She works every day for about 10 hours and believes she does well because of her dedication and effort.

Leonilda is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help provided she will buy building supplies to improve her home.  She will continue working and striving to reach her greatest dream: to own a business.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is widowed with four children; all of her children go to school. She has no additional family members. She sells secondhand clothes from home. She has been in business for five years. She works seven days a week.  

She has applied for a loan of 100,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy bales of secondhand clothes. Her major business challenges include seasonality (rainy season) which hinders her movements and defaulters. She is aspiring to get her own house and also to become a wholesaler . She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bales of secondhand clothing.

loans.name: Redeth

texts.en: Redeth is married with one child and she does not go to school. She has one additional family member. She operates a restaurant at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for three years. She works seven days a week.  She has applied for a loan of 100,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy rice, beans, flour and charcoal. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She aspires to get a permanent residence.  She resides in a rented house and the family has no access to electricity and running water. Her monthly expenses include rent and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more rice, beans, flour, and charcoal.

loans.name: Awa's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe est composé de deux femmes qui sont voisines et amies de longue date, elles font partie d'un Banc Villageois qui existe depuis le 9 juillet 2011.

Madame Awa la représentante du groupe est une femme mariée âgée de 43 ans, elle est mère de cinq enfants trois garçons et deux filles. Elle mène un petit commerce de petit déjeuner chez elle. Elle a une bonne expérience dans son domaine d'activité. Elle est debout à droite habillée de robe multicolore à gauche de la photo.

Son prêt lui servira à acheter 40 litres d'huile, 1 sac de farine, 1 sac de sucre, 10 tablettes d’œufs pour espérer plus de revenus. 

Avec ses bénéfices elle a pu carrelé sa chambre à coucher et son salon.
texts.en:
This group is composed of two women who has been neighbors and friends for a long time. They are part of the 'banc villageois' in existence since July 9, 2011.  

Ms. Awa, the group's representative, is a married woman, 34 years old, and the mother of five children, three boys and two girls. She has a small business selling breakfasts at her home. She has good experience in this domain of work. In the photo, she is the one standing at the left and wearing a multi-colored dress.

Her loan will be used to purchase 40 liters of oil, a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, and 10 trays of eggs in hopes of more income. 

With her profits, she has been able to tile her bedroom and her living room.

loans.use: to sell breakfast.

loans.name: Estrellita

texts.en:
Estrellita is 41 years old and married with four children. Three of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Estrellita has a business buying and selling seafood in the Philippines. Estrellita requested a 27,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more cooler boxes and plastic-ware to increase her seafood to offer for sale.

Estrellita has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Estrellita would like to save enough money to build a grocery store at the public market.

loans.use: to purchase more cooler boxes and plastic-ware to increase her seafood to offer for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy furniture.

loans.name: Edson Junior

texts.es:
Edson es un joven de 24 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con sus padres, el es muy trabajador, entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; gracias a su esfuerzo Edson pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Contabilidad.
Por iniciativa propia, Edson trabaja en el área de almacén de una empresa comercial de su ciudad, adicionalmente tiene un pequeño negocio de venta y reparación de equipos celulares, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Edson se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprara mayor cantidad de equipos celulares, repuestos, baterías y otros, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener un gran negocio comercial.
texts.en:
Edson, 24, is a single young man living with his parents in the city of Pucallpa.  He’s very hardworking and enthusiastic and focuses all his efforts into getting ahead.  Thanks to his efforts, Edson was able to study Accounting.

On his own initiative, Edson works in the warehouse department of a commercial firm in his city and he also has a small business selling and repairing cell phone equipment.  He works every day for about 10 hours and believes he does well thanks to his dedication and effort.

Edson is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support provided he will buy larger amounts of cell phone supplies, spare parts, batteries, etc.,  and will continue working and striving to reach his great dream: to own a great commercial enterprise.

loans.use: to buy cell phone equipment, spare parts, batteries, etc.

loans.name: Turamirize Group

texts.fr:
Mugeni  fait partie du groupe  Turamirize et  habite à Bujumbura. Elle est mariée  à Séverin, un commerçant. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants  âgés de 1 à 18 ans dont 4 étudient. 
 
Elle fait le commerce du riz   depuis 9 ans. 

Elle  est   à son  huitième    crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de kilos de  riz, à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle  voudrait acheter une parcelle  puis construire une maison et voir ses enfants  étudier.
texts.en:
Mugeni is part of the group Turamirize and lives in Bujumbura. She is married to Séverin, a merchant. Together they have five children, from 1 to 18 years old, of whom four are students. 

Mugeni has been doing commerce in rice for nine years. 

She is on her eighth Turame loan. With the KIVA loan she is obtaining, she is going to increase her capital and purchase many kilograms of rice to resell, so as to earn more. 

In the coming years, she would like to purchase a parcel of land to build a house and to see her children educated.

loans.use: to purchase many kilograms of rice to resell, so as to earn more

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell for her general store business.

Amalia successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Amalia's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Verónica Johanna

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita, pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

En este lugar vive la señora Verónica, tiene 29 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación  tiene dos  hijos de 8 y 2 años, el mayor estudia en escuela. Su esposo trabaja en una fábrica en Manta.

Doña Verónica para ganar algo por su cuenta y poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica al comercio, vende maíz, balanceado y otros alimentos para animales de granja, este negocio es muy bueno ya que la mayoría de las personas de su localidad se dedican a la cría de estos animalitos por lo cual sus ventas están aseguradas, a ella le gusta lo que hace ya que se gana algo sin tener que salir de su casa, esto le permite además estar al tanto de las necesidades de sus hijos y de su hogar. Lleva 5 años con su  negocio el mismo que le deja muy buenas ganancias.

Va a utilizar este crédito para comprar maíz, balanceado y arrocillo. Lleva 5 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con su primer crédito empezó en su negocio. 

Su sueño es seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
The communal bank María Auxiliadora meets in the parish of Sequita. Sequita is in Montecristi, a prosperous canton in the province of Manabí, which is full of hardworking and dedicated people who are proud of their roots.
