The loan has helped her to increase her income, doubling the amount she can sell from five to ten liters of milk per day. By this means, she was also able to improve her family’s living conditions, for which she appreciates all lenders for such an opportunity. 

Now she is in need for a second loan to buy 30 goats. She always wanted to keep goats and with the help of this loan, she will be able to realize her dream. Still, her goal is to offer a better life to her family and provide a better education for her children. She also hopes in the future to build another stable for goats and expand her farm. She wants to thank all of the lenders for both loans, which have helped her to achieve her dreams. She is aware that without the loans and assistance, she would never have been able to accomplish her goals.

loans.use: To buy 30 goats.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine is married with five children, and all her children go to school. She has no additional family members. She operates a food  stall of fruits and vegetables at the market. She sells her goods to all kinds of people on a retail basis. She has been in business for two years. She works six days a week.   

She has applied for a loan of 100,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy fresh beans, tomatoes, onions, Irish potatoes and pineapples. Her major business challenges include transportation and electricity. She is aspiring of educating her children to university level. She resides in a rented house, and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expense includes school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more fresh beans, tomatoes, onions, mangoes and pineapples.

loans.name: Eseza

texts.en: Eseza is married with two children, and both her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business of a beauty salon and has been in this business for eight years. She has applied for a loan of 2,500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, boxes of Vaseline, weaves, braids and a hand dryer. She generates additional income through selling used and new ladies shoes. She works from home seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include defaulters, the ever increasing prices of cosmetics in Uganda, which affects her customer base, and on and off electricity. She is aspiring of owning a fully stocked beauty salon and also to build her business premises. She resides in the family house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and paying for utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more boxe of cream relaxers, boxes of Vaseline, braids and a hand dryer.

loans.name: Anush

texts.en:
Anush and her big family live in Kapan city. Anush has graduated Kapan Medical College, where she has received a specialty of nurse, but she has never worked. She has two sons and a daughter. Her daughter is already a student, and her sons are still school-aged. 

In 2005, Anush and her husband opened their own business. They began their clothes and food trading business. She sells in their shop men's, women's and children's clothes and toys. Anush also sells a great range of sweets, dairy products, bread, alcoholic and non-alcoholic drinks, etc. All the needed products she brings from Yerevan in a rented car.

Anush asks a loan of $3,000 dollars in order to buy seasonal clothes for adults and clothes for pupils.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothes for adults and clothes for pupils.

loans.name: Norayr

texts.en:
Norayr lives in the village of Kavart, which is in the Syunik region of Armenia. He studied at the Kapan Mountain-Metallurgical College, but since he got married very early he became engaged in farming and agriculture. Norayr has five children; three sons and two daughters. His elder son specializes as a of geologist and one of his daughters is a midwife. His other children are still school-aged. His wife does not work and she helps her husband in their farming activities. 

On their farm they breed two cows, two piglets, ten chickens and thirty-six beehives. They cultivate some vegetables for their own use. Norayr is also very well known in his village, because of his pure and tasty honey that he sells. 

Norayr has some plans of enlarging his cattle farm and he asks for a loan of 1,000,000 Armenian drams to buy three calves, animal fodder and some hay.

loans.use: to buy three calves, animal fodder and some hay in order to enlarge his farm

loans.name: Biziyuda

texts.ru:
Бизиёда женщина в возрасте 62 лет.  К большому сожалению  несколько месяцев назад ее муж умер.  Он был ей опорой и поддержкой. У нее  3 детей, двое дочерей и сын.  Дочери уже замужем, сына еще не женила. 
 Бизиёда работает медсестрой в больнице. В этом году она хотела  сделать дома ремонт и женить сына, но часть денег ушло на похороны  мужа.  Сын Бизиёды работает в одной из частных фирм, он также вносит непосильный вклад в семейный бюджет. Пока еще не похолодало она хочет провести ремонт  дома, а потом уже женить сына , для этого она хочет получить кредит в Арванде чтобы закупить строительные материалы.  Бизиёда и ее сын очень надеятся на поддержку от Арванд.
texts.en:
Biziyuda is a 62-year-old woman.  Much to her sorrow, her husband passed away a few months ago; he was always a source of strength and support for her.  She has 3 children — 2 daughters and a son.  Her daughters are already married, while her son has yet to marry.  Biziyuda works as a nurse in a hospital.  Her son works in a private company, and also makes a significant contribution to the family budget.  

This year, Biziyuda wanted to renovate her home and see her son married, but she had to pay for her husband's funeral expenses.  She would like to have her home renovated before it gets cold, and have her son married thereafter.   Biziyuda and her son are counting on the support of Arvand; she hopes to receive a loan to buy construction materials to use for the renovation.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to renovate her home

loans.name: Jesca

texts.en:
Jesca is a 40-year-old married woman with 2 children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She operates a retail shop for second hand clothing but also practices farming in order to earn additional income. 

Despite having hardships such as a lot of competition and bad weather, her vision is to own a boutique.

Jesca intends to use the loan to buy second hand clothing to sell.

loans.use: to buy second hand clothing to sell.

loans.name: Azganush

texts.en:
Azganush has already been involved in the production of pastry products for ten years. She is already very skilled and known among her local customers due to her tasty pastries. She sells the products at local shops and gets money which is vital for her family's living. Azganush lives with her husband and daughter who assist Azganush very much.

Now this hardworking woman needs financial support to purchase materials in bulk and keep them for the winter season. Since during the winter season the materials that Azganush needs for the production of pastry products are very expensive, she wants to purchase them and keep them. Now Azganush is asking for a loan. She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 

The loan is very important for Azganush to purchase sugar, flour and margarine. She will be very grateful to lenders for assisting her with her pastry production.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flour and margarine to make different pastry products

loans.name: Sirasi

texts.en: Sirasi is a thirty eight year old married man with seven children living in Kasese, Uganda. For twenty years he has been operating a retail shop but also practices farming to earn additional income. He began this business in order to support his family. Being the good father that he is, he desires to educate his children up to University level and expand his business to new areas. Sirasi intends to use the loan to buy plastic items and glasses to sell.

loans.use: to buy plastic items and glasses to sell.

loans.name: Siah

texts.en: You are welcome to meet 21-year-old Siah from Liberia, who resides in the community surrounding the Airport of Liberia in Margibi county, which has the largest producing rubber plantation in Liberia. Her two children live at home. Her children are between the ages of 1 and 2.  For seven years now she has been involved with a video club business. Her mother assisted her with the money which enabled her to establish this business. She makes more profit and has more customers. She is asking for a loan to buy more African movies CDs, gas for her generator, etc. for her business. Her plan is to open another video club in the next community.

loans.use: to buy more African movies CDs, gas for her generator, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Anush

texts.en:
Anush is 33 years old. She is a young and successful businesswoman who lives in Gavar City in the Gegharkunik region. Anush graduated from Gavar Musical College and currently works there as a teacher. Anush is not married and she lives with her parents. In addition to her teaching job she also runs her own clothing business. From a rented stall she sells men's and women's clothes which she brings from Yerevan City wholesale markets. Anush's mother helps a lot in this additional clothing business.
Anush requests a loan of 900.000 Armenian drams to buy autumn-winter clothes. Anush has already paid back two loans to Nor Horizon without any delays.

loans.use: to buy a lot of autumn-winter clothes to sell

loans.name: Armen

texts.en: Armen is a farmer from the village of Ayntap in the Ararat region. His family consists of his wife and three school aged children (a son and two daughters). Armen is currently engaged in livestock farming which is the main source of his families income. Armen also cultivates some vegetables, which are sold in the local market. The family’s needs are growing day by day and he needs to work harder to earn a living. Armen currently is eager to enlarge the number of livestock he has. To be able to do so, he requests USD $3,000, which will assist him greatly to purchase cows and to buy some forage for his pigs. Armen has already taken a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately wasn't able to pay it back. However, thanks to their hard work in recent times, Armen was able to run his agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that he will be able to cover the monthly payments. So, he has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. Armen and his family is thankful to all the lenders for helping them to maintain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase cows and to buy some forage for his pigs and piglets

loans.name: Armenuhi

texts.en: Armenuhi is a hard working agronomist from the village Vosketap in the Ararat region. She lives with her husband and two small children (son – 6 years old, daughter – 2 years old). The family earns a living through the cultivation of tomato, cucumber and some fruits (peach, apricot, cherry, apple, grapes). This is the only source of the family's income. Armenuhi's husband helps her a lot in selling the agricultural products at the local market. To be able to continue the business, Armenuhi needs to make some investment. She needs a loan of USD $3,000 to buy some fertilizer, to purchase fuel for her agricultural machinery, to pay water bills and to pay laborers their harvest wages. She and her family rely on the good will of the lenders and are very thankful to them for their support.

loans.use: to purchase fuel for her agricultural machinery, to pay water bills and to pay labourers their harvest wages

loans.name: Jennet

texts.en: Jennet lives in Margibi county which is the largest producing rubber plantation in Liberia, she is 40 years old, she is unmarried and has two children aged 9 and 23, they both live at home and attend school. For the past ten years she has been selling palm oil, rice, pepper, etc in the local market. She spends eight hours a day, six days in a week, and usually uses a taxi to transport her goods to her stall. She requests a loan to buy more palm oil, rice, pepper, etc for her business, and her plans for the future are to educate her children and build a house.

loans.use: to buy more palm oil, rice, pepper, etc for her business

loans.name: Silverio

texts.es: Silverio es un pequeño comerciante que se dedica la venta de ropa usada y granos básicos de forma ambulante en los departamentos del país. Habita en la ciudad de Managua, y actualmente está tratando de mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, solicita el crédito para terminar de construir el servicio higiénico de su vivienda al que le hace falta la puerta y cambiar el techo, comprará materiales de construcción como cemento, arena, láminas de zinc, madera.
texts.en: Silverio is a small merchant who sells used clothing and basic grains.  He works as a street vendor in the departments throughout the country.  He lives in the city of Managua and is currently trying to improve his family's living conditions.  The loan he is requesting is to finish the bathroom at home, since it needs a door and a new roof.  He will buy construction materials such as cement, sand, metal sheeting and wood.

loans.use: To buy materials such as cement, sand, metal sheeting and wood planks.

loans.name: Abel

texts.es: Abel tiene 19 años de edad y vive en la comunidad de Sunchubamba en la provincia de Paucartambo, él es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces su actividad económica es el mantenimiento de artefactos eléctricos como radios, televisores  y otras cosas más, él es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Tres Cruces de Oro” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo como transistores, resistencias, chips, cables, estaño y otras cosas más, él agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Abel, 19, lives in the community of Sunchubamba in the province of Paucartambo.  He is a hard-working entrepreneur who supports his family through his business.  He provides maintenance services for electrical items such as radions, television sets and other goods.  He was invited to joing the communal bank "Tres Cruces de Oro" (Three Gold Crosses) because of how responsible he is.

The loan requested by Abel is to buy work materials such as transistors, resistances, chips, cables, pewter and other items.  He is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy work materials such as transistors, resistances, chips, cables, pewter and other items.

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es: Maruja tiene 35 años de edad y vive en la comunidad de Sunchubamba en la provincia de Paucartambo, ella es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces su actividad económica es la venta de verduras y frutas, ella es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Tres Cruces de Oro” y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo papayas, piñas, plátanos, papas, lechuga, zanahorias, tomates y otras cosas más, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Maruja, 35, lives in the community of Sunchubamba in the province of Paucartambo.  She is a hard-working entrepreneur who supports her family through her business selling fruits and vegetables.  She was invited to join the communal bank "Tres Cruces de Oro" (Three Gold Crosses) because of how responsible she is.  The loan she is requesting is to buy merchandise such as papayas, pineapples, bananas, potatoes, lettuce, carrots, tomatoes and other goods.  

She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as papayas, pineapples, bananas, potatoes, lettuce, carrots, tomatoes and other goods.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: Don Luis tiene 47 años de edad, es originario de la ciudad de Granada, casado, padre de 1 hijo. Se dedica a brindar el servicio de reparación, venta de llantas y accesorios para auto móviles desde hace 11 años. Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa quien trabaja en una zona franca. Solicita el crédito para comprar: llantas, rines, parches calientes y fríos entre otros. Estima que el crédito será de mucha ayuda, ya que podrá invertir en materia prima  la cual necesita para realizar su trabajo y satisfacer  las necesidades de sus clientes. Su plan futuro es comprar un local para su negocio donde pueda ofrecer sus productos y brindar un servicio de calidad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Luis, 47, is married and has a son.  He lives in the city of Granada, and for 11 years has been in business offering auto repair services, tires and other accessories.  His wife, who works in the duty free zone, supports him.

Luis is requesting a loan to buy tires, rings, hot and cold patches, etc.  He believes the loan will be of much help as he will be able to buy the raw materials he needs to do his work and satisfy customer needs.  In the future he wants to buy a shop for the business where he can offer customers quality services and products.

loans.use: To buy tires, rings, hot and cold patches, etc.

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.es: Benedicta tiene 36 años de edad y vive en la comunidad de Sunchubamba en la provincia de Paucartambo, ella es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces su actividad económica es el cultivo de trigo y cebada, ella es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Tres Cruces de Oro” y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas y abonos, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Benedicta, 36, lives in the community of Sunchubamba in the province of Paucartambo.  She is a hard-working entrepreneur who supports her family through her business growing wheat and barley.  She was invited to join the communal bank "Tres Cruces de Oro" (Three Gold Crosses) because of how responsible she is.

She is requesting a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers.  She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Kelvin

texts.en:
Kelvin is 22 years old and supports seven children at his farm in Chisamba District, Zambia. Kelvin is asking for a Kiva loan so that he can purchase a water pump to irrigate and expand his farm.

Though he is young, Kelvin has been active in growing vegetables and raising chickens, and has recently opened a small shop in his community. Farming however, remains at the core of his business. He has plans to expand both his poultry farm and his vegetable crops, however he currently lacks the water pump needed to cultivate a larger area.

Water pumps can be a major boost for farmers such as Kelvin. A water pump allows farmers to water their crops more regularly, while also increasing the area they are able to cultivate. Unfortunately, the upfront costs of such a water pump can be very prohibitive. Once he secures a loan, Kelvin will be able to get a water pump from Rent-to-Own, which will deliver the equipment to his farm, as well as provide training on how to use and maintain it.

Kelvin hopes that with a water pump he will be able to earn more money from selling tomatoes and watermelons, supporting the expansion of his poultry business. He hopes that through his many business activities he will be able to take all his children to school. It is for this reason Kelvin is asking Kiva lenders to support his goal of securing a water pump as soon as possible.

loans.use: to obtain a water pump for irrigation

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 51 years old and is a nurse and farmer within Chibombo District, Zambia. She is asking Kiva lenders to assist her in securing a loan so that she can expand her farm.

Using buckets to water her crops, Helen has been maintaining a small farm in her spare time, selling cabbage and tomatoes to local markets. However the labour required to maintain her crops is intensive and Helen often struggles to properly water her crops after a long day of work. Helen hopes that a water pump will be the key to her success.

Water pumps can be a major boost for many farmers such as Helen. They allow for farmers to continue growing high value vegetable crops, using less labour than manual watering, and freeing their time for other activities. Unfortunately the upfront costs of such a water pump can be prohibitive. Once she secures a Kiva loan, Helen will get a water pump from Rent-to-Own, which will deliver the pump to her farm and provide training on how to properly maintain and use the equipment.

Helen plans to use the water pump to begin growing new crops, including butternut squash, and okra. She plans to use the extra income to support her children in school and even expand into poultry rearing. It is for this reason Helen is asking for a Kiva loan so that she can secure a water pump as soon as possible.

loans.use: to obtain a water pump for irrigation

loans.name: Maria Santos

texts.es:
Doña María Santos tiene 38 años de edad ella es agricultora por tradición ya que en su familia por generaciones se ha trabajado la tierra siendo este rubro el factor económico de su familia. Ella tiene un grado de educación primaria cursado hasta el tercer grado, es madre de 5 hijos de los cuales el mayor ya es casado en hogar a parte y los demás están viviendo con ella y estudian. La siembra y cultivo de papa es el rubro que ella y su familia trabaja la cual al final de la cosecha es vendida a los intermediarios y vecinos de la zona donde ella habita, estos a su vez la re venden en el mercado local o a nivel nacional. También en ocasiones cuando el precio de la papa es bueno deja ganancias para distribuirla en la siembra de granos básicos como el maíz y frijol. Sus cultivos están ubicados aproximadamente a una hora y media de camino de su casa de habitación siendo este uno de sus desafíos por lo que la asistencia no puede ser a diario.

Sus planes a futuro son los de poder mejorar su casa de habitación ya que es necesario como el piso, el techo, repello entre otros que evitaran la acumulación de humedad por estar al descubierto. También seguir apoyando a sus hijos en sus estudios para que ellos puedan graduarse y superarse por medio de sus estudios. Ella ha solicitado un financiamiento con el cual comprara semilla certificada de papa para poder cultivar e insumos agrícolas con los cuales dará el mantenimiento necesario posible para obtener una excelente cosecha.
texts.en:
Maria Santos is 28 years old. She is a farmer by tradition, since her family has worked the land for generations for their living. She has been educated to third grade level. She is the mother of five children, the eldest of which is married and living away from home. The others are living with her and studying. Planting and growing potatoes is what her family does. At the end of the harvest, the produce is sold to intermediaries and neighbours, and then resold in the local market or throughout the country. Also sometimes when the price of potatoes is good she puts some of the profits into planting staple grains, such as corn and beans. Her crops are located approximately an hour and a half’s walk away from her house. This distance is one of the challenges she faces, and it means she cannot be there every day.

Her future plans are to improve her house as necessary, such as the floor, the roof, and plastering, in order to avoid the accumulation of humidity due to being uncovered. She also wants to continue supporting her children in their studies so that they can graduate and get ahead through their studies. She has requested a loan, with which she will buy certified potato seed and farming supplies to do the necessary maintenance to obtain an excellent harvest.

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies and certified seed for the planting season

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to perform maintenance on his vehicle.

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.es: Saturnina tiene 63 años de edad y vive en la comunidad de Sunchubamba en la provincia de Paucartambo, ella es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces su actividad económica la agricultura donde cultiva trigo, cebada, papa, tubérculos, hortalizas y otras cosas más, ella es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Tres Cruces de Oro” y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas y abonos, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Saturnina, 63, lives in the village of Sunchubamba in the province of Paucartambo. She is a hardworking and enterprising person who provides for her family with her hard work. 

Her business activity is agriculture. She cultivates wheat, barley, potatoes, root vegetables, vegetables, and other crops. She is a responsible person, which is why she was invited to participate in the "Tres Cruces de Oro" communal bank. 

On this occasion, she needs this loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. She appreciates and values this loan, and she promises to comply with the payment of her monthly installments very responsibly.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Edith Elizabeth

texts.es: Edith es una joven de 20 años de edad, en la actualidad no trabaja se dedica a sus estudios profesionales, la carrera de Marketing y publicidad, ella tiene muchas expectativas en su educación, desea ser eficiente, poder obtener experiencia laboral en el campo de su carrera y desarrollarse como persona, recibe el apoyo de su madre quien con su labor como costurera le ayuda. Edith solicita el crédito para pagar el curso de titulación de su carrera y un postgrado en Gerencia de Marketing y ventas.
texts.en:
Edith, 20, is currently not working because she is studying a professional degree in Marketing and Advertising. 

She has many goals in terms of her education. She hopes to be productive, to gain work experience in her field of study, and to grow as a person. Her mother supports her with her work as a seamstress. 

She has applied for a loan to pay for the final fees surrounding her undergraduate degree qualification, as well as for a postgraduate degree in Marketing and Sales Management.

loans.use: to pay for her qualification and postgraduate degree.

loans.name: Uuljan

texts.ru: Уулжан 39 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 1 дочь. У Уулжан - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, Уулжан занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 19 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Уулжан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 1 теленок, 40 овец, а также имеет земельный надел размером 2,0 ГА, на которой она ежегодно выращивает: фасоль. Ежемесячный доход Уулжан составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Уулжан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) с целью использовать кредит на сбор урожая. Уулжан хочет оплатить услуги наемным рабочим за сбор урожая фасоли. Доходы от кредита Уулжан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на строительство нового дома.
texts.en:
Uuljan is 39 years old, married and raising one daughter together with her husband. Uuljan has secondary education. As a main income for her family, Uuljan works with livestock breeding and field crop cultivation, after having started 19 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Uuljan's persistent work, her farm currently has one dairy cow, one calf and 40 sheep. She also has a plot of land of 2.0 hectares where she grows beans every year. Uuljan's monthly income is 10,000 som (KGS). 

With an aim to further develop her business, Uuljan turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) with an aim to use the loan for the harvest. Uuljan wants to pay the workers to help harvest the beans. Uuljan plans to invest the income from the loan in increasing the number of household animals, and plans to save money for building a new house.

loans.use: to pay workers to harvest beans

loans.name: Kulumkan

texts.ru: Кулумкан 31 год, разведена, одна воспитывает сына. У Кулумкан - средне-специальное образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Кулумкан занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 8 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Кулумкан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 8 овец, а также имеет 3,20 ГА земельной доли, на которой ежегодно выращивает фасоль и многолетние травы. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Кулумкан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на использование кредита на сбор урожая. Кулумкан хочет нанять рабочих для сбора фасоли и оплатить за их услуги. Доходы от кредита Кулумкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение сына.
texts.en:
Kulumkan is 31 years old, divorced and raising a son by herself. Kulumkan has specialized secondary education. As a main source of income for her family, Kulumkan works with livestock breeding and field crop cultivation, after having started 8 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Kulumkan's persistent work, her farm today has two dairy cows, eight sheep and also 3.2 hectares of land. On this she grows beans and perennial grasses. The monthly income is 10,000 som (KGS).

With an aim to further develop her business, Kulumkan turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 20,000 som (KGS). Kulumkan wants to hire workers to help her harvest the beans and pay for their services. Kulumkan plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing the number of household animals, and plans to save money for the continued education of her son.

loans.use: to pay the workers for their help to harvest of beans

loans.name: Nurizat

texts.ru: Нуризат 25 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У Нуризат - высшее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Нуризат занимается полеводством, стартовав 8 лет назад, с 30,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Нуризат, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1,50 ГА земельной доли, на которой ежегодно выращивает: перец, помидоры и фасоль. Каждый год получает хороший и богатый урожай. Реализует оптом на местном овощном рынке. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Нуризат обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 65,000 сом (KGS) на использование кредита на сбор урожая, намерена нанять рабочую силу, должна оплатить за работу им, также сюда включаются затраты на комбайн по сбору урожая. Доходы от кредита Нуризат планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Nurizat is 25 years old, married, and together with her husband, is raising two children. Nurizat has a university education. As the main source of income for her family, Nuriza practices crop farming. She started this business 8 years ago, with a start-up investment of 30,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Nuriza's hard work, on her farm she currently has a 1.5 hectare plot of land, on which she grows peppers, tomatoes and beans. Every year, she receives a rich and bountiful harvest. She then sells her produce in bulk at the local vegetable market. Her monthly earnings are 15,000 som (KGS). For the further development of her farming business, Nurizat turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum and Partners." She is requesting a loan in the amount of 65,000 som (KGS) to use for harvesting. Her intent is to hire workers, and she should not only pay for those who work for her, but also for a combine harvester to harvest the crops. Nurizat plans to invest the earnings from the loan into acquiring livestock in the future.

loans.use: to hire workers and a combine to help her harvest her crops.

loans.name: Nasima

texts.ru: Насиме 55 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У Насимы - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Насима занимается животноводством, стартовав 28 лет назад, с покупки скота на 250 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Насимы, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 6 дойных коров. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Насима обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для откорма с последующей реализацией на рынке по высокой цене. Доходы от кредита Насима планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, а также намерена накопить средства на обучение внуков в институте.
texts.en: Nasima is 55 years old, married, and together with her husband, is raising two children. Nasima has a secondary education. As the main source of income for her family, Nasima practices livestock breeding. She started this business 28 years ago, with an initial purchase of cattle in the amount of 250 som (KGS). Thanks to Nasima's hard work, she currently has six dairy cows on her farm. Her monthly income is 10,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing her business, Nasima turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum and Partners." She is requesting a loan in the amount of 120,000 som (KGS) to buy sheep to to fatten them up for resale on the market at a good price. Nasima plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also intends to save money for her grandchildren's university education.

loans.use: to buy sheep for resale

loans.name: Spartak

texts.en:
Spartak still continues his business (taking photos, selling sweets and ice cream, popcorn and cheeps), which is located in an amusement park in Kapan city. His two children are still students in paid divisions, and his elder son lives and works in the Russian Federation. 

Spartak’s wife does not work, and Spartak alone works very hard to provide for his family. He has rented his stall for a very long period and he hopes that he will be able to do some innovations in his business.

Spartak has already taken two loans from Kiva and he is also a good client for Nor Horizon. He hopes that this time again Kiva lenders will support him. He asks for a loan of 300,000 AMD to buy some materials for photographing and a new batch of goods for his stall.

loans.use: to buy photography materials and a new batch of goods for his stall.

loans.name: Zephanus

texts.en: Zephanus is a 43-year-old married man with three children who lives in Kasese, Uganda. For four years, he has been practicing farming. With the proceeds, he has been able to educate his children. Like most farmers, he is challenged by unpredictable weather changes and price fluctuations while his dream is to become a model farmer. Zephanus intends to use the loan to buy fertilizers and cotton seeds.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and cotton seeds.

loans.name: Harutyun

texts.en:
Harutyun is a private entrepreneur from Gyumri, a city in the Shirak region. His family consists of his wife and two school-age children. Harutyun's wife works in the church. To meet the family's daily needs, Harutyun runs a small local store where he sells grocery products, fruits and vegetables as well as household goods. The store is very small, and the income Harutyun gets from the store hardly covers the family’s costs. 

To maintain the small business and to become more competitive in the local market, Harutyun wants to expand the assortment of the products he sells in the store. A loan of $3,000 will be a huge support to the hardworking man and will enable him to buy grocery products, fruits and vegetables as well as household goods to resell in his store. Harutyun and his family will be grateful to all the lenders for helping them acquire the needed loan.

loans.use: to buy new grocery products, fruits and vegetables as well as household goods to resell in his store.
